loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: La señora Natividad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y es madre de 01  hijo, que aun depende de ella.Natividad, es una mujer perseverante, eficiente y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de pasamanerías, ubicado en el Mercado Nº 01, en un puesto muy bien acondicionado. En la actualidad, le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. Su espíritu luchador, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará  arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de pasamanería y mercadería de ropas.Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.

loans.use: Comprará pasamaderia, abarrotes y mercaderias de ropas.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas”, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y por los que cada día se empeña en seguir adelante.Se dedica a la venta de chorizos y cecinas, lleva 12 años trabajando con este negocio, ubicada en el Mercado Nº 01, le va muy bien ya que tiene bastante acogida y sus clientes ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que a diario, tiene muy buenas ventas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará kilos de cecinas, chorizos y cecinas, para luego venderlos por kilos. Cree que si pone más entusiasmo y optimismo podrá cumplir con sus sueños.Dice: “Agradezco al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberme ayudado a salir adelante y a iniciar mi negocio con un capital, ahora me siento una mujer realizada y capaz”.

loans.use: Comprará cecinas y chorizos en kilos.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La señora Delia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años y es madre de 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen  de ella. Motivada por su experiencia en la crianza de gallinas se amino a convertir esto en un negocio, en inicio en muy pequeña escala invirtió los  S/. 300.00 de crédito que recibió, obteniendo muy buenos resultados por lo que continúa con este negocio hasta la actualidad, en su propia casa.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprará gallinas ponedoras de huevos, vitaminas, alimento balanceados en sacos para mantener las aves sanas y gordas y puedan producir mejor. Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Delia belongs to the “Mujeres Virtuosas” communal bank, district of Tarapoto, Department of San Martín. She is married, 41 years old, and mother of 6 children, 2 of which still depend on her. Motivated by her experience in raising hens, she was encouraged to turn it into a business. Beginning on a small scale, she invested the S/. 300 .00 (about $100 USD) of credit she received, gaining very good results. Consequently, she has continued with this business into the present in her own home. With this loan of S/. 3,000.000 ($1075 USD), she will buy hens for laying eggs, vitamins, and bags of balanced feed to keep the birds healthy, fat and better producing. Today she is happy for the work and services that are offered, and thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her that would like to work and get ahead. She hopes that this continues for a long time, and that they help many families and businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more live hens

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es: La señora Merlita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 41 y es madre de 02 hijos, que ya son independientes y son su gran orgullo.Merlita, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Merlita, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Merlita belongs to the “La Libertad” communal bank, District of Picota, Picota Province, Department of San Martín. She is married, 41 years old and mother of 2 children, who are already independent and are her great pride. Merlita is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her life path. The desire to get ahead has given her good results, and today, with the business she manages, she is very content with her achievements. She began selling cosmetics of different lines such as Unique, Esika, Leonisa and Avon, a business in which she continues today. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, she will buy beauty products for her stock such as women’s and men’s perfumes, creams, pressed powders, lip pencils, and nail enamel, as well as another case to display her products. Merlita, with her maturity, is an example to follow for many women to start a business and, with perseverance, will be able to reach their dreams. This is thanks to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for helping her start her own business and other women to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Obaid Shaker Group

texts.en:
Sarui is the group leader of Obaid Shaker group. There are five members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to improve their business and make it larger. So they have requested a group of loan 50,000 Afghani.

Sarui wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store.

Row Gul wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Fawzai wants to take a loan for her embroidery business.

Rawbi wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver.

Moneri wants to take a loan for her husband who has a photography shop.

So they are all very happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her husband's general store

loans.name: Parwen Tabash Group

texts.en:
Parwen is the group leader of Parwen Tabash group. There are five members in this group and they each want to take a loan to expand their business. So they have requested a group of loan 50,000 Afghani.

Wasala wants to take a loan for her quilt-making business.

Parwen wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Bobo Gul wants to take a loan for her son who is a huckster.

Afghan Gul wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Farzhna wants to take a loan for her bead-working business.

They thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Gul Sir

texts.en:
Gul Sir is the daughter of K.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan in a family of four members.

Gul Sir wants to take a loan for her husband who has a car-parts shop. He needs to cover all the necessities of his family and pay for all the expenses. He has a car-parts shop for which he still needs some tools.

Gul Sir is requesting an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani. Her husband is confident that, with the loan, he can increase his business.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy tools for his business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en una pequeña casa que junto a su esposo (Elías, de 28 años) construyeron con sus propias manos. Lo que más quiere Elena es brindarles a sus 3 queridos hijos: Brígida de 7, Renzo de 5 y Yakelin de 2 años unos buenos estudios para que en el futuro puedan salir adelante por sí solos.

Los 11 años que Elena viene realizando la crianza de ganado le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, ella realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 15 años y actualmente se ha convertido en una de las ganaderas más solicitadas, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a la ciudad de Juliaca.

Lo que más le gusta a Elena de su trabajo es criar a sus animales, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses, pero lo más difícil para ella es transportar las reses hasta el lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar otros ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Elena con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Elena invertirá los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita en comprar una vaca, la cual le costará alrededor de tres mil nuevos soles, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero de sus ahorros, con tal de aumentar el número de sus reses.
texts.en:
Elena is a very loving mother of a family who lives in a house with her husband (Elías, 28) which they built with their own hands. What Elena wants most of all is to give her three children (Brígida, 7, Renzo, 5 and Yakelin, 2) the opportunity to study so that in the future they can manage on their own. The 11 years that Elena has been raising cattle has allowed her to carve out a dignified life for herself. She has been raising cattle since she was 15 years old and she has converted herself in one of the most sought after cattle farmers to date, due to the strong animals that she sells in the city of Juliaca. What Elena likes most of all about her job is raising her animals, as she now knows that the better she cares for them, the more money she will earn from them. However, the most difficult part is transporting the animals to the the place where they are sold, as this activity demands a lot of time and effort In the future she would like to have a grocery store, with which she could generate other income and in doing so improve her family's quality of life. This is the second loan that Elena is applying for with MFP. She feels a responsibility to make her repayments on time, as she doesn't want to create problems with the members of the community bank, where she is very loved for the happiness she brings to the meetings. Elena will invest the 1500 nuevos soles that she is applying for in the purchase of a cow. This will cost around 3,000 nuevos soles, so in addition to the loan she will add money from her savings so that she can increase her number of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Para Elías la crianza de ganado es una actividad que le viene de familia, desde muy pequeño aprendió a realizar esta actividad y actualmente los sigue haciendo y su ganado es muy solicitado en las ferias de su localidad.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo a Elías es pastear a sus animales y poder permanecer al aire libre, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es llevar su ganado hasta las distintas ferias para venderlos. Para más adelante espera incrementar el número de animales que tiene para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Elías con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una vaca para incrementar su ganado, para ello está dispuesto a poner también parte de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Elías, 28, lives in his own house with his wife. What he wants more than anything is to improve their quality of life. For Elías, raising cattle is an activity that came to him from his family. Since he was very small he learned how to do this activity. He currently continues doing it. His cattle are very sought after in the local fairs. What Elías likes most about his work is taking his animals to graze and being able to stay in the fresh air. He has been doing this activity for 15 years. The most difficult part for him is taking his cattle to the different fairs to sell them. He hopes to later increase the number of animals he has to be able to improve his income. This is Elías’ second loan with MFP. He feels happy about the opportunity for the loan. He is a much loved member of his communal bank. He always helps with everything that is needed. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he is asking for to buy a cow to have more cattle. He is prepared to use part of his savings as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en una pequeña casa, la cual ella misma construyó con sus propias manos y lo que más quiere es brindarle a su familia una buena vida. Los 15 años que Feliciana viene realizando la crianza de ganado le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, ella realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 15 años y actualmente se ha convertido en una de las ganaderas más solicitadas, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a la ciudad.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar a sus animales, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses, pero lo más difícil para ella, es transportar las reses hasta el lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Para más adelante desea implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, la cual le pueda generar otros ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Feliciana con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal. Feliciana invertirá los mil nuevos soles que solicita en comprar una vaca, la cual le costará alrededor de tres mil nuevos soles, para ello pondrá dinero de sus ahorros para completar la suma necesaria.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 30, is a very loving mother. She lives in a small house, which she built with her own hands. What she wants most of all is to give her family a good life. The 15 years that Feliciana has been raising cattle have served to forge a decent life. She has been doing this activity since she was 15. She has currently become one of the most sought after cattle ranchers due to the size of the animals that she takes to sell in the city. What she likes most about her work is taking care of the animals. She knows that the better she takes care of them, the better price she will get for her animals. The most difficult part for her is transporting the animals to the place where she sells them. It is an activity that demands much time and effort. Later she would like to set up a grocery store in her house. Then she could generate other income and improve her family’s quality of life. This is Feliciana’s second loan with MFP. She feels responsible about paying it back on time. She does not want to enter into problems with the members of her communal bank. Feliciana will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy a cow. That will cost around 3,000 PEN, but she will use money from her savings to have the necessary amount.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 59 años, vive sola en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. La crianza D. ganado es la actividad que desD. muy niña realizó Isabel, en la localidad D. Saman (Comunidad del distrito D. Azangaro) ella fue aprendiendo este negocio D. sus padres, quienes siempre se preocuparon por darle una actividad con la cual defenderse en el futuro.

Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es pastear a sus animales, ya que disfruta mucho del aire libre, lleva 30 años en esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es llevar su ganado hasta las ferias dominicales donD. venD. sus reses. Para más adelante espera incrementar la cantidad D. ganado que tiene actualmente, para así mejor sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo D. Isabel con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una D. las socias más responsables. Con los mil soles que solicita comprará una ternerita lechera, la cual le costará aproximadamente tres mil quinientos soles, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Isabel is a very hard-working woman. She is 59, and she lives alone in her own house. What she wants most of all is to have a peaceful old age. Raising cattle is the activity that she has done since she was a young girl. She does this in the area of Saman (a community in the Azangaro district). She learned this business from her parents who were always concerned about giving her an activity so that she could take care of herself in the future. What she likes most about her work is taking her animals to graze and really enjoying the fresh air. She has been doing this activity for 30 years. The most difficult thing for her is taking the cattle to the Sunday fairs where she sells her animals. Later she hopes to increase the quantity of cattle that she currently has in order to improve her income. This is Isabel’s second loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time. She is one of the most responsible members of her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy a female calf. That will cost approximately 3,500 PEN, but she is prepared to use money from her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a female calf

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 23 años y vive en su casa propia con su esposo (Gregorio, de 27 años) y sus 2 hijos; William de 6 y Jonatan de 4 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Para Lourdes la crianza de ganado es una actividad que ha ido aprendiendo a lo largo de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió este trabajo de sus padres, quienes se esforzaron mucho para darle una buena vida.

Ella lleva a vender su ganado a la feria dominical del distrito de Azangaro, donde consigue unos buenos precios, ya que sus reses son las más grandes y fuertes de toda la feria, debido a los buenos cuidados que ella les brinda. Lleva 10 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, mientras que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria, ya que le es muy cansado y demoroso, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Para el futuro espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Lourdes con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los mil setecientos soles que solicita planea comprar una ternera, la cual le costará aproximadamente mil nuevos, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en comprar forraje (pasto) para su ganado.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking young woman. She is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Gregorio (age 27), and their two sons William (age 6) and Jonatan (age 4). Her family is the reason behind all of her efforts. Lourdes has been raising cattle most of her life. She learned the trade from her parents, who tried to provide her with a good life.

She sells her livestock at the Sunday fair in Azangaro District. Since she takes great care in raising her cattle, Lourdes is able to command good prices because her animals are the largest and strongest in the entire fair. She has been in business for 10 years and enjoys feeding her animals. The most difficult part for her is transporting her animals to the fair because it can be a tiring and time-consuming activity. Yet she knows that she must continue to work hard to obtain her goals. In the future, Lourdes would like to increase the number of cattle in her herd so that she can improve her income.

This is her second loan with MFP. Lourdes feels she has a responsibility to make her payments on time, even if it means setting aside some money a little bit at a time. She is an active and supportive member of her Communal Bank, which is why she is highly respected by the rest of the group. With her loan of 1700 soles, she plans to buy a calf (for 1000 soles) and fodder for the rest of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf & fodder

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
A sus 35 años, Martha ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, es madre soltera y vive con su única hija, Juana de 13 años y desea con todas sus fuerzas tener un futuro más prometedor.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia.

Martha tiene 20 años trabajando en la crianza de ganado, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para sacar a pastear a sus animales, los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza depende la ganancia que obtendrá por venderlos.

Lo que más le gusta a Martha de su trabajo es caminar por lo inmensos campos por donde pastea a su ganado, por lo  que espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así poder aumentar sus ingresos. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que llevar las reses hasta Azangaro, que es donde las vende, aun así ella está dispuesta a trabajar duro con tal de mejorar su vida.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Martha con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil setecientos soles que solicita completará la suma que necesita para poder comprar un toro, el cual le costará al rededor de tres mil nuevo soles.
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Martha has fought hard to excel in life. As a single mother living with her only daughter, Juana, 13, she wants with all her efforts to have a more promising future with age, members of her family and civil status.

For the past 20 years Martha has been working in breeding cattle. She gets up at 5am to take her animals out to graze, tending them with much care and dedication, as she already knows that good breeding will affect the profits she can obtain in selling them.

What Martha likes most about her work is walking through the immense fields where she grazes her cattle and she hopes to increase the number of cattle that she owns and thereby increase her profits. What she likes least about her work is having to take the cattle to Azangaro where she sells them, but she is still ready to work hard to improve her life.

This is the second loan for Martha with MFP and she commits to pay all instalments on time as she feels a responsibility to the partners of the communal bank, where she is very well respected for the order she brings to meetings. The 1,700 soles that she is requesting will complete the sum she needs to buy a bull, which will cost her around 3,000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Para Natividad la crianza de ganado es una actividad muy rentable, pues ella cuida muy bien a sus reses, las alimenta adecuadamente y las mantiene sanas, es por eso que su ganado es uno de los más solicitados en las ferias dominicales. 

Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es cuidar a sus animales, puesto que ella les tiene mucho cariño, por lo que espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene para mejorar sus ingresos. Lo más difícil para ella es llevar su ganado hasta las ferias, puesto que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr alcanzar sus metas.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Natividad con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil soles solicitados planea comprar más forraje (pasto) para su ganado y así alimentarlo mejor.
texts.en:
Natividad, 30, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to excel in life.

For Natividad, breeding cattle is a profitable activity as she looks after the cows very well, feeding them appropriately and maintaining their health. For this reason, her cows are among the most sought-after cattle at Sunday fairs.

She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years and most enjoys looking after her animals, which she does with much care, in the hope that she will be able to increase their number and improve her income. The hardest thing is taking her cattle to the fairs, which makes her very tired, but she knows that she must work very hard to achieve her goals.

This is the second loan for Natividad with MFP and she is ready to pay her instalments on time to avoid prejudicing the remaining partners of the communal bank, where she is well-loved for the responsibility she shows. With the 1,000 soles requested, she plans to buy more food (pasture) for her cattle to feed them better.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food for her animals

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer que siempre quiso salir adelante, tiene 61 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su familia.

El campo le ha dado a Victoria los recursos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia, ella se dedica a la crianza D. ganado desD. que tenía 15 años, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres y actualmente sus reses están muy bien cuidadas y alimentadas, es por eso que en la feria D. Huancane y Juliaca, que es donD. lleva a vender su ganado, sus reses son las más solicitadas por los compradores.

Para Victoria lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que llevar su ganado hasta las ferias dominicales, puesto que le es muy cansado y agotador, lleva 30 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es pastear a sus animales. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número D. aimales que tiene para así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo D. Victoria con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una D. las socias más responsables. Con los mil soles solicitados planea comprar un toro, el cual le costará al rededor D. tres mil soles, para ello pondrá parte D. sus ahorros para alcanzar el monto necesario.
texts.en:
Victoria is a woman who always wants to move forward. She is 61 years old and lives in her own house together with her family.

The field has provided Victoria with all necessary resources to be able to maintain her family. She has been working in breeding cattle for the past 15 years, an activity that she learnt from her parents. Currently, her cows are very well cared for and fed and for this reason, at the fair of Huancane and Juliaca, where she took her cattle for sale, they were the most sought-after cows by buyers.

For Victoria, the hardest thing about her work is taking the cattle to the Sunday fairs, which makes her very tired and worn out. She has been in this business for 30 years and most enjoys grazing the animals. In the future, she hopes to increase her number of animals and thereby improve her profits.

This is the second loan for Victoria with MFP and she is ready to pay her instalments on time as she wants to gain access to subsequent loans. In her communal bank, she is one of the most responsible partners. With the 1,000 soles requested Victoria plans to buy a bull, which will cost her around 3,000 soles. She will combine the loan with some of her savings to reach the necessary total.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married. She is an entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov. She runs a small business selling curtains and curtain fabric in one of the local malls called “Hermes”. She has been in this trade for 15 years. There are quite a few competitors in Valentina's trade, however, the wide assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her little store beats all others. Currently, Valentina has about 42,000 Grivnas invested in stock. She earns about 4,200 Grivnas in net profit each month.   

Valentina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase her working capital and purchase additional merchandise at a wholesale price. The current loan will not only help Valentina develop her business and grow her sales, but it will also provide secure jobs for her two employees.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise at a wholesale price

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María C. D. P. D. 52 años D. edad resiD. en San Martin municipio del departamento D. San Salvador con sus tres hijos. Ana es una persona trabajadora a pesar que cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos quienes dos D. ellos trabajan, ella nunca deja a un lado su negocio y su independencia económica, son ya diez años los cuales Ana ha dedicado a su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su casa, las ventas que Ana realiza son diarias, distribuye variedad D. artículos como ropa y zapatos en su mayoría, el motivo del crédito que solicita es para comprar nueva mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 52 years old and lives in the municipality of San Martin in San Salvador with her three children. Ana is a hard worker, and also counts on the support of two of her children who also work. She never neglects her work and her financial independence, and for more than 10 years now she has run a business from her home selling shoes and clothing. She will use this loan to purchase new merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel H. L. de 59 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapan en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Miguel se encuentra casado vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijastros. Miguel es un hombre de buen corazón ha estado al cuidado de los hijos de su esposa quien lo reconocen como un padre, Miguel a sacado adelante a su familia por medio de los servicios de su negocio, el maneja un molino en el cual ofrece servicios para procesar todo tipo de alimentos, en esta oportunidad el solicita de un crédito para comprar otros molino ya que su demanda por su negocio ha ido a aumentando.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel H. L. is 59 years old and lives in San Pedro Perulapan, in the Department of Cuscatlán. Miguel is married and lives with his wife and four stepchildren. Miguel is a good-hearted man and has taken care of his wife's children, who regard him as a father. Miguel has helped his family get ahead by operating his own business: he runs a mill which offers processing services for all types of foodstuffs. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to purchase an additional mill, since the demand for his services has been increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a new mill

loans.name: Ruth Catalina

texts.es: Doña Ruth se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, adicionalmente la señora tambien es lider de su zona. Su mercaderia la distribuye en las oficinas a pagos, paralelamente la cliente tambien trabaja en Bancos de Emprendimiento, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningun problema en el pago de sus cuotas.  La señora tiene estabilidad domiciliaria ya que vive en casa familiar de forma independiente, comparte su departamento con sus hijos y su esposo el cual le colabora con los gastos del hogar.  El crédito será destinado en la compra de cosmeticos que se encuentren en oferta.
texts.en:
Ruth's business is selling cosmetics from a catalog line, and she is the leader in her area. Her merchandise is distributed in local offices. She has also been working with other entrepreneurial banks, and she has never had a problem making her scheduled payments. Ruth has a stable home life, living independently in an apartment with her children and her husband, who also helps with the household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase cosmetics which are currently available at a reduced price.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in merchandise at a reduced price

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es: William Ernesto A. P. de 24 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapan en el departamento de Cuscatlán. William vive con su esposa, posee una panadería con aproximadamente cuatro años de experiencia, William a puesto todos los esfuerzos en su negocio sacando producción de pan los 7 días de la semana, razón por la cual es muy reconocido, el surte de su pan a muchas tiendas de su colonia, pero lastimosamente su producción cada vez se va quedando corta comparada a la demanda que posee, es por ello que solicita este crédito para compra un nuevo horno que le permita sacar más producción de pan.
texts.en:
William Ernesto A. P. is 24 years old and resides in San Pedro Perulapan in Cuscatlán. William lives with his wife and owns a bakery, having approximately four years experience. William puts all his efforts towards producing bread seven days a week, for which he's well known. He provides bread to many shops in his area but, unfortunately, his production is coming up short each time when compared with the demand that he has. It is for this that he is requesting this loan to buy a new oven that will allow him to produce more bread.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new oven.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es: Juan Miguel M. M. de 35 años de edad reside en el departamento de Usulután. Juan vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El departamento de Usulután es muy reconocido por sus playas cercanas a la costa de oriente, cosa que sabe aprovechar muy bien, Juan todo un salvadoreño emprendedor se dedica a la pesca y venta de mariscos, donde posee una clientela muy estable por sus bajos precios y excelente calidad de productos, el ahora solicita de un crédito que le permita surtir su inventario de mariscos.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel M. M., 35, lives in the Usulután department with his wife and two children. The Usulután department is very well known for its beaches near the eastern coast, which Juan enjoys very much. Juan, a totally Salvadoran entrepreneur, fishes and sells seafood. He has a fixed customer base because of his low prices and the excellent quality of his products. He is now asking for a loan that will allow him to stock his seafood inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his inventory

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona C. D. M.  D. 59 años D. edad resiD. en Tejutla municipio del departamento D. Chalatenango. Petrona vive con su esposo y su único hijo llamado Carlos. Petrona es una mujer con muchas responsabilidades, es la mano derecha D. su esposo ya que es el apoyo económico incondicional, ella ha instalado un tienda en su casa con la cual logra generar ingresos que son D. gran utilidad para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ella solicita D. este crédito para reinvertir en su negocio surtiéndolo D. nueva mercadería.
texts.en:
Petrona C. D. M., 59, lives in the Tejutla municipality in the Chalatenango department. She lives with her husband and her only child, Carlos. Petrona is a woman with many responsibilities. She serves as her husband’s right hand helper giving unconditional economic support. She has installed a store in her house. It has generated income, which is very useful in covering the household expenses. She is asking for this loan to reinvest in her store and stock it with new merchandise. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia J. D. F. resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután vive con su esposo y sus hijos viven con su madre, para Rosa es muy difícil separarse D. sus hijos y verlo únicamente los fin D. semanas ya que por su trabajo y por motivos económicos ha decido que el mejor lugar para que sus hijos puedan ser cuidados en casa D. su madre, es por eso que Rosa trabaja muy duro para mejorar su situación económica y poder traer D. nuevo sus hijos a su hogar, para esto también necesita D. un crédito que le permita aumentar su inventario en ropa interior para mejorar sus ventas D. esta manera tambien sus ingresos mejoraran.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia J. D. F. lives in the Usulután department with her husband. Her children live with her mother. It is very difficult for Rosa to be separated from her children and only see them on the week ends. Because of her work and for economic reasons she has decided that the best place for her children to be taken care of is in her mother’s house. That is why Rosa works so hard to improve her economic situation to be able to bring her children home again. To do this she also needs a loan that will allow her to increase her inventory of underwear. This will improve her sales and her income will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business with clothes

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María De Los Ángeles D. de 46 años de edad reside en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad. María es madre, vive con sus dos hijos. María es una madre con muchas responsabilidades ella trabaja para poder brindarles estabilidad a sus hijos, se ha dedicado a negocios de ventas de manera ambulante en el mercado donde distribuía productos como ropa y papel higiénico, ahora ella ha estabilizado un negocio de comida desde su casa con el cual logra cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, ella ahora solicita de este crédito para comprar  mayor cantidad de materia prima y así aumentar sus producción al igual que sus ventas.
texts.en:
María De Los Ángeles D., 46, lives in the Santa Tecla municipality in the La Libertad department. María is a mother, and she lives with her two children. María is a mother with a lot of responsibilities. She works to be able to give her children stability. She is a street vendor, and she sells products like clothes and toilet paper in the market. She has now established a business of selling food from her house. With this business she is able to pay for the household expenses. She is now asking for a loan to buy more raw materials. This way she will increase production and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Danelyn

texts.en:
Danelyn C. is a 21-year-old single woman living in the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. Danelyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Danelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Danelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn C. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine C. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Josephine is married and has four children. To make a living, Josephine operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling charcoal in the local community. Josephine chooses to remain at a loan amount of 5,000 Philippine pesos for her third loan cycle. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Josephine's new loan of 5,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the village of Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Josephine is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to save for the future.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married to Rex and they were blessed with four children. The couple is living in Bacnor East, Burgos, Isabela, with their children. They are managing a simple business, which is a vehicle-repair shop that serves to provide for the educational needs of their children. Her dreams is for her children to finish their studies for she believes that education is the key to progress. She is glad that aside from their repair shop, her husband is also managing a farm for an alternative source of income.  

She is now in need of additional capital for the maintenance of her repair-shop business. For this, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. The loan will greatly help her to maintain their small repair shop.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane Z. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old. Mary Jane is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Mary Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: wer Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita C. is from the village of Pala-o, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Carmelita is separated from her spouse and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business of making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon, or Mar as he is called in their village, is married to Rosemarie and they are gifted with one child. The family lives in the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. They want their child to have a progressive living someday and so they strive to continuously send him to school until college. They help each other to earn income for their survival and for the future of their only child.

Despite the economic crisis that is happening in the country, Marlon is doing his best to uplift their poor living situation. He patiently tills his rice field in order to have a productive harvest. Furthermore, Marlon also manages a hog-raising business that is also of big help in meeting the needs of the family.

Due to financial difficulty, Marlon wants to request financial assistance of PHP 32,000 from Kiva lenders to enable him to purchase the needed agricultural supplies for the maintenance of his crops. He hopes that his harvest will become more plentiful and that he will earn a higher income with the continuous support of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna M. is from the village of Mitan-ag, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and is married. Edna owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa P. is from the city of Tinago Ozamiz. She is 46 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Milagrosa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized "mangga" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mango fruits in the local community. Milagrosa has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Milagrosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and strengthen her business. Milagrosa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Milagrosa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leycith

texts.es:
Leycith es una mujer que tiene 47 años, vive feliz con sus 3 preciosos hijos: Juan Carlos de 14 años, Charol de 13, y Daniel de 5 años. También cuenta con la compañía de su esposo (Amílcar), de 50 años, en una acogedora casa de un tranquilo barrio al norte de la ciudad de Lima.
Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería para damas, desde hace dos años, cuando descubrió lo rentable que era este negocio; ya que siempre son necesarias y muy buscadas las prendas interiores de buena calidad a un bajo precio. Muchas veces le hacen pedidos y en otras oportunidades ella misma compra la mercadería a su gusto y luego la vende a sus amistades y vecinos. 

A Leycith le gusta vender lencería porque se siente identificada con el rubro, ya que es mujer y sabe las necesidades femeninas. Adicionalmente, trabaja también en la preparación de comida en un comedor popular de su distrito, ya que esta actividad le favorece en el ahorro de los gastos de su hogar. 

Para el futuro le agradaría tener una tienda de ropa interior femenina en un mercado de alguna zona concurrida cerca de su casa.

Este es su tercer préstamo con  MFP y promete ser puntual, como siempre, en cada pago. Además se lleva bien con todas las integrantes de su banco comunal porque son amigas suyas y las conoce muy bien. Leycith piensa invertir el dinero que solicita en mercadería para lograr tener capital y así lograr tener un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Leycith is a 47-year old woman who lives happily with her 3 beautiful children: Juan Carlos, who is 14 years old, Charol, who is 13, and 5-year old Daniel. She also has the company of her husband (Amilcar), 50, in a cozy house in a quiet suburb north of Lima. Two years ago she discovered that the sale of lingerie for women is very profitable, given that these items are always necessary and many people look to buy good quality undergarments at a low price. Ever since that time she has been engaged in this business. Many times she takes orders, but other times she just buys merchandise to her liking and later sells it to friends and neighbors. Leycith likes to sell lingerie because she can identify with the products, since she is a woman and knows what women need. She also works preparing food in a popular eatery in her district, since through this activity she can save to pay for household expenses. In the future she would like to have a lingerie shop in a busy market area located close to her home. This is her third loan from MFP, and she is committed to be punctual, as always, in her payments. In addition she gets along well with all of the members of her communal bank because they are friends of hers that she knows well. Leycith is going to invest the money that she is requesting in merchandise so that she can build up her capital and in this way acquire a stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana,Cagayan. She is 59 years old, married and blessed with four children: Merlita 39, Frederick 38, Marites 36 years and Manuel 34 years old.  All of them are married and live in their separate homes. 

Dolores owns and operates a farming business and her crops are rice and bitter gourd that she sells in their village.  She has been in this business for over ten years.

Her need of financial assistance has encouraged Dolores to request a loan from the KIVA lenders for the amount of PHP22,000.  This loan will be used to pay for the labor of the farmers who will assist her with the farming and also to purchase farm equipment.  She hopes that through her income her business will improve and expand.

loans.use: To be used to pay for farm labor and equipment

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 61 years old and married to Jose, her partner in their blacksmith business.  They are living in the village of Larion Bajo Tuguegarao. They are blessed with eight children, seven of them have successfully graduated from college and their youngest is still studying.  

Clarita and her husband have worked together to improve their small business.  She hopes that through this, she may provide all the educational needs for her child.  In this regard, she wanted to asks for financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP13, 000. This will help them produce more blacksmith products for their village. Clarita hopes that they will someday raise their poor living condition.

loans.use: Additional capital for her manufacturing business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.es:
Belinda tiene 37 años, es madre de 4 niños: Jorge de 18, Brigite de 14, Jenifer de 9 y María de 5 años. Vive con sus hijos y su esposo (Hidalgo), de 38 años, en su casa ubicada en el distrito de Ventanilla de Lima.
Ella se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de Internet en un espacio que implementó en su casa y durante las tardes trabaja en un local de comida. Además, concede en alquiler un motocarro que es de su propiedad y con las ganancias tiene una ayuda económica adicional. Como si fuera poco, cada 15 días esta laboriosa mujer se da tiempo para viajar a la sierra del país para vender ropa. Belinda considera sus labores muy rentables, ya que le están rindiendo buenas ganancias, pero lo que no le gusta es dejar mucho tiempo solas a sus pequeñas hijas, ya que están en edades en la que necesitan mucho los consejos de una madre, además de la ayuda que requieren en la escuela. 

Para el futuro Belinda sueña con tener su propio local de venta de comida peruana, donde pueda ofrecer gran variedad de platillos y así auto sostenerse para no dejar a sus hijas solas. 

Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, sabe que debe ser responsable y puntual porque todas las mujeres que conforman su banco comunal son muy cumplidas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería en ropa, además de comprar un nuevo motocarro que también dará en alquiler.
texts.en:
Belinda is 37 years old and the mother of 4 children: Jorge (age 18), Brigite (age 14), Jenifer (age 9), and María (age 5). Her husband Hidalgo is 38 years old. Belinda and her family live in the district of Ventanilla of Lima.

She rents out Internet booths in a designated space in her home and sells food from a vending space in the afternoons. At the same time, she also owns a motorcar that she rents out for additional income. Every 15 days, this hardworking woman also travels to the mountainous region of the country to sell clothes. Belinda says her jobs are very profitable because they generate good income, but she does not like spending time away from her small daughters because they are at an age when they need their mother and require help with their schoolwork.

In the future Belinda dreams of having her own Peruvian food shop where she sells a variety of dishes, becoming self-sufficient, and not having to leave her daughters alone. She is taking her twelfth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to be responsible and punctual so that the other women in her Communal Bank remain happy. The money she is requesting will be used to buy more clothing and purchase a new motorcar for rental.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide additional capital to multiple businesses (Internet cafe, clothing sales, & motorcar rental)

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 59 years-old and married with four adult children. Erlinda owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erlinda joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna operates a transportation business and her husband is the driver. To help support the family, Edna also raises hogs at the back of their house. Their businesses help their family survive life's hardships. She hopes that they will continue to succeed and gradually raise their standard of living.

Edna is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 in order to repair and maintain the tricycle for their transportation business. Any leftover money will be used to purchase feed for her hogs. She hopes that her request will be granted because it will help their business grow.

Edna is married to Antonio who is a very responsible husband and father. He drives their passenger tricycle daily and when farming season comes, he also manages to cultivate their farm land. They have three children and all of them are already married. The couple lives happily in San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela.

loans.use: For maintenance and repair of a tricycle.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Frema

texts.en:
Frema is a very religious woman who always puts God first in whatever she does. Frema is 26 years old and resides in the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela together with her husband and two children aged four years old and two months old. As a mother, she is hoping to provide the best future for her children. For that reason, she is striving hard to maintain her business and hopes that someday she could extend it to a more stable business.

Frema has been engaged in a hog raising business for two years. She needs additional capital to purchase more hogs to raise and their supply of feed and medicines.  For her second loan, she is requesting to avail herself of a loan of PHP 5,000 for the maintenance and growth of her hog raising business. She is hoping that her loan will be approved because it will contribute a lot to the progress of her business.

loans.use: To purchase hogs, feed and medicines for her livestock

loans.name: Bethman

texts.es:
Bethman es un joven padre de familia que tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja (Norma), de 33  años, quien trabaja en un restaurante y a quien adora con todo su corazón, ellos tienen dos hijos: Chelsy de 10 y Jean Luca de 7 años.
A pesar de lo lejana que se encuentra su casa de la ciudad, cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, en la que él mismo atiende a sus vecinos amablemente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la noche, todos los días sin descanso. 

A Bethman le gusta mucho su negocio porque lo puede realizar en la comodidad de su hogar y además es muy rentable, ya que es la única tienda de por su barrio. 

Para un futuro no muy lejano desea mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y también surtirla con mayor variedad de productos. Bethman sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene recompensa, es por eso que día a día se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y hace todo lo posible por mejorar en la vida. 

Por tal motivo se ha animado a pedir su primer préstamo con MFP y sabe que debe esforzarse y ser responsable para cancelar todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mejorará las vitrinas de su tienda y comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bethman is a young father who is 31 years old. He lives with his partner Norma, who he adores with all his heart. Norma is 33 years old and works in a restaurant. They have two children: Chelsy (age 10) and Jean Luca (age 7).

Even though his home is located far from the nearest city, Bethman has a grocery store in which he graciously serves his neighbors. He is open every day without fail from 6 am until nightfall. He likes the fact that he can manage his business from the comfort of his own home. Since his store is the only one in the community, his business is very profitable.

In the near future, Bethman wants to improve the facilities of his store and also add a variety of products to his inventory. He knows that his efforts will be rewarded, so he strives every day to support his family and do everything he can to improve their way of life.

For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from MFP. He knows that he must be responsible and make his payments on time. With the money he requested, Bethman will purchase display cases for his store as well as merchandise in larger quantities so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cases & merchandise to expand his inventory

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex R. is a 32 year old farmer from Norala, South Cotabato.  He started managing his 1 hectare rice field in 2004.  On May 2009, he joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because of its good program.  It helped him finance his business with a low interest rate.

Now he is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.), payment for a hand tractor, and labor.  This will help him to not delay the application of farm inputs on his farm.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: 45 year old farmer Roy I. has a rice farming business in Norala, South Cotabato.  He owns a one and a half hectare rice field.  He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is thankful for the services it offers.  He would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 as financial assistance to his farm business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una mujer de 43 años que tiene 2 hijos: Andrei de 23 y Luis Ángel de 4 años. También vive con su pareja de toda la vida, Ángel de 42 años, quien es obrero de construcción.
Desde hace 3 años ella tiene una pequeña librería en su casa. Se decidió por este negocio al notar que no había alguna librería cerca de su casa, por lo cual considera su negocio muy rentable, ya que no tiene competencia cercana, además puede vender otros productos en el mismo espacio. A Dina le gusta su trabajo porque es independiente y puede realizarlo desde la comodidad de su hogar y puede dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos, los cuales necesitan mucho de ella. 

Para el futuro quiere tener una tienda más surtida y grande, en la cual pueda ofrecer variados productos, ya que está pensado habilitar un espacio para poder vender comestibles y artículos de tocador, como jabones, pasta dental;  además de detergentes, etc. esperando expandir así su negocio y abastecer las necesidades de toda su clientela. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, a ella le gusta conformar su banco comunal, pues siente seguridad y responsabilidad en el grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más útiles de escritorio para su librería, además de otros productos para complementar su negocio así agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Dina is a 43 year old woman with 2 sons, Andrei (age 23) and Luis Ángel (age 4). She lives with her partner Ángel, who is 42 years old and a construction worker.

For three years, Dina has managed a small bookstore out of her home. She says she started this business because there was no other bookstore nearby and thought it would be very profitable since she would not have any competition. Dina also sells other products from the same retail space. She enjoys her work because it allows her to be independent. In addition, she can work out of the comfort of her own home and spend time with her children who still need her.

In the future, Dina wants to have a larger store that is stocked with various products to offer. She intends to have more space so that she can sell groceries and toiletries such as soaps and toothpastes, as well as detergents and other items. By expanding her business, Dina hopes she can meet the needs of her customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. Dina enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because she thinks it is a trustworthy and responsible group. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase stationery for her bookstore and other products to complement and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand her inventory

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores A. is the mother of six children, the eldest being 13 years old. They live in Norala, South Cotabato and have a rice-farming business. Since 1996, she has had this kind of business to sustain her family and the income she receives is helpful in paying her children’s tuition fees. She said that sometimes they have a good harvest and sometimes not.

Dolores is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This will help her a lot to buy farm necessities.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Colita

texts.en: Colita A. is from the village of Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Colita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Colita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies and to purchase another piglet to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and another piglet

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa G. is age 20, and has a 1-year-old child. She lives in Norala, South Cotabato.

Jessa started her rice farming business in 2004. She has a hectare (2.5-acre) rice field which is the main source of income for her family. At present, she would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase additional farm supplies and to pay for a hand-tractor.

Jessa likes the program offered by Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) for it helps people like her to finance their business. She has been a member of CEVI since 2008. She is thankful that she will be able to finance her business with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and married to Manuel Rodriquez, a tricycle driver in their village at Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. The couple is blessed with four children and they are helping one another to support the needs of their family.

Elvira manages a vegetable-selling business, and does her best to meet her family's needs through the income she generates.

Due to the growing needs of her family, Elvira noted that she needs to double her income. To have additional capital, Elvira is requesting PHP10,000 from KIVA lenders in order to improve her business and eventually increase her daily income.

Elvira has a strong determination to fulfill her dreams in life. She wants to be able to improve her family's poor way of living by improving and expanding her business.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has six adult children.

Elsa owns and operates a specialized retail store, making and selling different accessories in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials used to make the accessories and that would add up to their items intended for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials used to make the accessories and that would add up to their items intended for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G. is a 50-year-old farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. She generally receives a good income from her one-hectare rice field, but sometimes not, due to pest attack. She has 6 children; the eldest is 27 years old. She sustains her children's education through her farm.

Most of the farmers in their area are helped in financing through Community Economic Ventures, Inc., and she joined in May, 2008. Now she's requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. With this she will be able to sustain her business and provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 33 años ha trabajado con valentía para su familia. Ella vive con su esposo (Iván), de 47 años, y con sus dos hijos: Miguel de 19 e Iván de 7 años. Iván es obrero de construcción.
Un buen día al ver que los amigos de su esposo buscaban un lugar donde beber algunas cervezas, Hilda pensó en vender ella misma esta bebida, ya que vio que era muy rentable. 

Para lograr esto habilitó la sala de su casa comprando algunas sillas y mesas para ofrecer mayor comodidad, es así que desde hace 4 años vende cerveza y así obtiene buenas ganancias, sobre todo los fines de semana que es donde hay mayor demanda, ya que la gente descansar y a sale a divertirse. 

Su hijo menor la ayuda en este negocio, ya que el mayor trabaja; pero lo que no le gusta es trasnochar y no dormir bien los fines de semana, pero sabe que las ganancias económicas son muy buenas y que si quiere progresar debe realizar algunos sacrificios. Ella espera muy pronto cumplir todas sus metas, entre ellas, la de tener una bodega.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta del trabajo en su banco comunal es la responsabilidad de cada uno de sus miembros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sus propias cajas de cerveza, ya que las que tiene en la actualidad son prestadas y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a businesswoman, whom in her 33 years has worked with valiance for her family. She lives with her husband, Iván, 47 years old, and her two children, Miguel, 19, and Iván, 7. Iván is a construction worker.

One fine day, seeing that her husband’s friends were looking for a place to drink some beers, Hilda thought she would sell them this drink herself since she had heard that it was very profitable.

To achieve this, she furnished a room of her house, purchasing chairs and tables to offer more comfort. Here, she has sold beer for 4 years and has obtained good profits, especially on the weekends when there is the highest demand, since the people relax and go out to have fun.
