Ronald has a dream of owning his own premises so that he could save on rent since it is too much for the kind of business he does. He also hopes to have children and ensure that they all go to school and have better jobs than he has. He is seeking his first loan to help purchase a second television set that will help improve the view in the cinema.

loans.use: To purchase a television set for his cinema hall.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora sells provisions and foodstuff. She is 55 years old and married with seven children. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more provisions and foodstuff. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Matida Namakula 's  Group

texts.en: Matilda is 33 years old and married with four children between 8 and 16 years old.  All her children go to school. She resides and owns a three-room house where she is staying with six people. Matilda takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  She is a retailer selling charcoal in Namungoona. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for six years, servicing her 12th loan.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Betty sells to all categories of people both at retail and wholesale. She buys her charcoal from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and so she incurs transport costs to and from the market. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season, as she works from an open place. Matilda wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to see her business grow stronger and start selling only at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Belkis Mercedes

texts.es: Belkis Mercedes O. P. tiene 26 años con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Y surgió con la necesidad de salir adelante, ya que anteriormente quien se dedicaba al negocio era su Mama ya que siempre le gusto ofrecer productos de manera ambulante en las calles, y así salían todos los días en los diferentes mercados en busca de clientes. Por lo que más adelante decide encargarle el negocio a su hija Belkis así fue como ella no tuvo ningún problema en mantener esta actividad. Ella espera muy pronto proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda, para que sus hijos puedan vivir con las condiciones necesarias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, perfumes, cremas y mercadería variada.
texts.en:
Belkis Mercedes O. P. is 26 years old and by working hard has helped her family get ahead. She has had to work hard because her mother used to be the one running the business. She has always liked roaming the streets selling goods. They used to go out together to all the various markets looking for clients and since Belkis was good at it, she decided to turn the business over to her. She hopes to do some home improvement very soon so her kids can live in good conditions. Her loan is for working capital to buy clothing, perfume, creams, and other merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr: Ramata BÂ, 37 ans, mariée, 2 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de NIAFOR depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle a été 7 fois bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Avec son crédit elle envisage de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises pour de croitre ses revenus afin de pouvoir faire face aux besoins familiaux
texts.en:
Ramata BÂ, aged 37, is married and has two children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de NIAFOR for three and a half years. She has been a loan recipient seven times and has never had a repayment problem. With her loan, she envisions bolstering her store with merchandise to grow her revenues in order to cope with family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her shop

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel N. is 20 years old and single. He lives with other family members in Bugesera district, a western province of Rwanda where he owns a small retail shop. This general store sells different kinds of products and has been in operation since 2007. He works by himself in the store, which is open everyday from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. 

Emmanuel is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business. He will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for sale in his store to attract more customers and serve existing customers better.

According the Emmanuel, the projected profits from the business, aided by the loan, are approximately 170,000 RWF ($300) per month. He hopes to save enough money to buy his own house and to save money as well to make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Rosette's Group

texts.en: N. Rosette is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and hard working lady with a grocery business that she has owned for six years. Her main business challenge is selling perishables like tomatoes and yellow bananas but apart from that, she is good. She has good customer care skills that enable her to sell all her stock. Her cleanliness also helps her plus selling quality products. She works hard to saves to ensure that she can own her stall and stop renting. She also wants to ensure that she continues with her children’s education up to the University level. Rosette is married with two children and she takes care of three dependants. She needs a loan to help buy more tomatoes, onions, cabbages, green pepper and so on for her grocery stall.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onions, cabbages and so on for her business.

loans.name: Ramathan's Group

texts.en: S. Ramathan is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a friendly and hard working man who sells agricultural products at Mukono Central market. He also has a cosmetics shop that is managed by his wife, and together they strive to make a better living for their family. Ramathan has 10 children, all in school except one who is still a baby. He is grateful that the loans have helped him take care of his family using the profits and savings from the increased capital. He buys most of his produce from the villages around Mukono and sometimes the farmers bring the produce to his stall themselves. Ramathan needs a loan to help buy more produce for resale at his stall.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 42 years and lives with four children between the ages of 3 and 9 years.  All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three- room house where she is staying with seven people. Rose takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  She has a stall selling plastics like cups, basins, plates and bowls.  She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for nine years, servicing her 20th loan.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Rose sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. She buys her plastics from factories in Nakawa Industrial area, one of the busiest towns in Uganda, and she incurs transport costs to and from the factory. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season, as she works from an open place. Rose wants to use this loan to buy more plastics. She hopes to see her business grow stronger and start selling only at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for resale

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. Akua lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. She is a trader. Akua trades in second hand textile goods such as ladies’ underwear. She sells on a tabletop at the local market square. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Akua buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old and cohabiting with four children aged 3 to 9 years, all of whom go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with seven people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.

Rose has a stall in the outskirts of Kampala where she sells plastics like cups, basins, plates and bowls. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for nine years and is servicing her twentieth loan. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home.

Rose sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale. She buys her plastics from factories in the Nakawa Industrial area, one of the busiest towns in Uganda, and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works in an open space.

Rose wants to use this loan to buy more plastics. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow stronger and to start selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more plastic articles to sell

loans.name: Zam's Group

texts.en:
K. Zam is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and hardworking lady and is married with four children, all in primary school. She also takes care of her parents.

Zam is a business lady with a retail shop in Kireka that she has owned for ten years and from which she is able to earn 240,000/= in profits each month. Over the years, she has learnt to handle her customers well, plus having quality products, and this keeps them coming back to her.

Zam would like to expand her shop so that she can continue selling a variety of items and in large quantities. She is seeking a loan that will help her restock her retail shop with more goods to sell.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more goods

loans.name: G.s. El Labrador Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario El Labrador tiene 2 integrantes que luchan cada día por salir adelante Francisco R. Q. y Haydalina R. Q.. Ambos tienen la misma actividad económica, ellos tienen mucho tiempo con este negocio ya que  fueron con esfuerzos propios. Francisco tiene muchas amistades en su comarca por lo que es de gran ayuda para él, ya que cuando sale a  buscar sus cerdos para el destace siempre obtiene un precio mucho más favorable. Anteriormente no tenía mucha producción porque no tenía capital suficiente, pero al notar que su demanda aumento entonces decide trabajar con Haydalina y juntos fueron creciendo por medio de los financiamientos. Ya que en la actualidad recurren a Fundación León 2000 en busca de un financiamiento que les sea de ayuda para sus negocio
texts.en:
El Grupo Solidario El Labrador (“The Jointly Liable Farmers Group”) has two members who struggle each day to get ahead, Francisco R. Q. and Haydalina R. Q.. Both have been in the same business on their own for a long time. Francisco has a lot of friends in his district which is a big help for him since when it is time to butcher his pigs he always receives a much more favorable price. Previously, he didn’t have much production because he didn’t have sufficient capital, but, noting that his demand increased, he decided to work with Haydalina and together their business is growing by means of financing. Currently, they are applying to Fundación León 2000 for a loan that will be of help to them in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: God Thank You Group

texts.en:
God Thank You is a group of 2 borrowers led by Kutumu K..  She is 30 years old and married with 3 children 3-15 years old.  Their educational levels are kindergarten - 7th grade.

Kutumu is illiterate, and she and her family live on the Selegai highway on the outskirts of Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Kutumu's business is general provisions shop.She buys general provisions wholesale and sell to residents of Selegai High Way, Voinjama the capital of Lofa county,northern Liberia.

She has been running this business for 3 years and hoping to improve to a bigger store in the future to come.

Kutumu has been facing some financial problems with her business but because she talks to her customers in a good manner in order encourage them to continue buying from her, she always believes her business will get better.

She needs this loan in order to purchase more provisional goods like batteries, bath soap, candles, magarine etc. to improve business.  Kutumu dreams of giving her children better education and good medical care.

loans.use: To purchase more provisional goods like batteries, bath soap, candles, magarine, etc. to improve business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is fifty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso.

Beatrice is a trader. She trades in plastic/metal buckets and other plastic wares. She sells on a table top at the local market square. Beatrice says she buys her goods from Kumasi and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy buckets and pans

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Hard work and determination are the driving forces in K. Janet’s business life. She is a responsible lady and married with 6 children, of which two are out of school and four are still studying.

Janet has a retail shop in Ndeeba that she has been running for 3 years. Because she knows how to handle her customers well, she is able to move on amidst all the stiff competition. She is grateful for her loans because they have made it possible for her to have enough stock for her shop, enabling her to make 100,000/= as profits a week. She vies to have a much bigger shop to enable her to continue developing.

Janet will use this loan it to purchase more goods for her shop so as to increase stock.

loans.use: Purchasing more goods for her shop so as to increase stock.

loans.name: Ataa

texts.en: Ataa sells secondhand textile goods such as bed sheets and dresses. She is 39 years old, married and has a child who is in school. Ataa lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Ataa buys her goods from Kumasi and sells on a tabletop at the local market square. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for a year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy secondhand textiles

loans.name: Jannette Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Jannette del Socorro García Chávez ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y junto a su pareja tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Su  negocio  es la compra-venta de cosméticos, ella trabaja con las empresas Avon y la Zermat, además de esto viaja a Managua a traer perfumes y cremas más baratos al mercado Oriental a las personas que se lo solicitan, por lo que la mayoría de sus ventas son por encargos, sin embargo ella trabaja también con créditos a recuperarse en plazos no mayores de 1 mes, con cuotas quincenales. Hace más de 8 años que dio inicio a este negocio, en la búsqueda de ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cosméticos al por mayor, ya que se acercan una muy buena temporada de venta y ella desea aprovechar comprar en este momento en que los precios están un poco bajos por la reducción de las ventas de los últimos meses para los proveedores. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda-bisutería en la cual pueda distribuir todos sus productos sin necesidad de ofertarlos casa por casa.
texts.en:
Jannette del Socorro García Chávez is 33 and married. She and her husband have three minor children. She buys and sells cosmetics. She works with the Avon and Zermat companies. In addition to this, she travels to Managua to bring to the eastern market less expensive perfumes and creams for the people who request it. The majority of her sales are by order. Nevertheless, she also works with credits for no longer than one month; the payments are biweekly. She started this business over eight years ago looking for income to bring her children a better quality of life. The loan is to buy wholesale cosmetics. A very good selling season is approaching, and she wants to take advantage and buy now when the prices are reduced a bit because of the vendors’ sales in these last few months. Her dream is to have a jewelry store where she could distribute her products without having to sell them door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45-year-old trader. She is divorced and the mother of two children. Her children have completed senior high school and are waiting to enter tertiary school. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to poverty and she is very serious about her business.

Beatrice trades in foodstuffs like plantain. She started this business seven years ago and has since seen positive changes in her business. Through it, she has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use her loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes with this loan she can buy bunches of plantain from the farmers, bypassing intermediaries who retail to her at high prices. She hopes to turnover the loan with her business to enable her to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy bunches of plantain

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija runs a provisions kiosk in the market square. She is 28 years old, married and has given birth to two children: one is currently in school while the other has yet to start. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Goaso, a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo region. Hadija buys her goods from Kumasi and sometimes from big shops in her community. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es:
El banco comunal Conchan de Milagro se encuentra a unos 30 minutos fuera de la Ciudad de Cuenca vía al Valle en el sur del país, es una comunidad de gente muy unida y solidaria entre ellos y con el turista nacional y extranjero, su clima frío favorece para la agricultura y ganadería además podemos disfrutar de un paisaje sin igual y la belleza de la fauna en su estado natural

La señora Martha Magdalena C. es socia activa del  banco comunal Conchan de Milagro, vive en la  comunidad del mismo nombre, tiene 22 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja, fruto de su unión concibió una niña de un año, su esposo trabaja como mecánico por ahora  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada por su papá.

Martha  se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a la cría de pollos, lleva seis meses desarrollando esta actividad  y nos comenta que le va muy bien porque no se ha muerto ni uno y todos los vendió en su comunidad a buen precio.

Este es su segundo ciclo trabajando con la fundación y esta muy contenta porque con el primer crédito montó su criadero de pollos,  con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de otros animales como  cuyes y chanchos así como en comida y vitaminas para su crianza, de ésta manera ir incrementando su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Conchan Miracle Community Bank is located about 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca in the valley in the south of the country. It is a community of very united people working together and with the national and foreign tourists. The cold climate is favorable for agriculture and livestock. We also are able to enjoy a landscape without equal and the beauty of the fauna in its natural state Mrs. Martha Magdalena C. is an active member of the Conchan Miracle Community Bank. She lives in the community of the same name, is 22 years old, and lives in common law marriage with her partner. Their fruitful union has resulted in a daughter who is one year old. Martha's husband works as a mechanic at present. They do not have their own house so they live in a house lent to them by her father. Martha works at domestic tasks and raising chickens. She has been developing this activity for six months and comments that it is going very well since not even one chicken has died and she sold all of them in the community at a good price. This is her second time working with the foundation and she is very content because with the first loan she started her poultry farm. With the new loan from the Foundation ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of more animals like guinea pigs and pigs as well as food and vitamins for raising the animals and in this way continue increasing her business. Her biggest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs and vitamins and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr: D. Olga est née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Olga vit à cadjehoun, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis vingt neuf ans. Mariée à HONHONOU Emmanuel un tisserand, Olga est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Olga n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école, mais depuis près de vingt ans, Olga vend de façon ambulante des tissus, des sacs et des savons dans son quartier et au marché. Olga s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Olga a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour agrandir son commerce et assurer l'évolution de ses enfants, Olga sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Olga D'almedia was born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Olga has lived in Cadjehoun, a district in Cotonou, for 29 years. She is married to Emmanuel Honhonou, a weaver, and is mother of two children who are both in school. The couple shares responsibility for the family's expenses. Olga has not yet had the opportunity to go to school, but for nearly 20 years, she has gone door-to-door to sell fabrics, bags, and soap in her district and at the market. Olga buys her supplies in Lomé, Togo, neighboring country of Benin. Olga has already received two loans that she repaid in full to Alidé. She is requesting a third loan through Alidé to increase her business and provide for her children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags, fabrics, and soaps

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en:
Felecien R. is 30 years old and single. He cares for two dependents aged 19 and 23. Felecien lives with his parents in Bugesera district, a western province of Rwanda.

Felecien has owned his bakery since 2006. His shop is open everyday from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and employs three people. His projected monthly profit from his business is 180,000 RWF (approximately US$300).

Felecien is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing additional equipment for making large quantities of bread.

loans.use: To buy additional baking equipment

loans.name: Jovia's Group

texts.en:
B. Jovia has a hotel business in Ntungamo that she has been running for three years. She has six children and some of them are at university. Jovia needs a loan to help buy more foodstuffs to prepare and to pay the school fees of her children. She is a hardworking and determined lady. She has a challenge in her business, because she a lot of debtors as customers affecting her cash flow. Nevertheless, she has been able to make 100,000/= in profit a week because of her quality services.

Jovia is the leader of her group in Ntungamo. She would like to expand her business in the future so that she can have more space and prepare a greater variety of foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Annabel Natividad

texts.es:
Annbel Sánchez es socia del Banco Comunal Everes, situado en la comunidad de Quemado  en la provincia de Manabí un lugar tranquilo donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura.

Annabel está casada con Jacinto un maestro en la construcción de casas, tiene 28 años ya es mamá de tres niños de 8 y 6 años y  un bebe de diez  meses al que   no lo puede dejar con nadie y siempre lo lleva donde va.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta informal de prendas de vestir como pantalones, blusas, interiores y bisutería,  recorre toda su comunidad visitando a sus clientes en su mayoría mujeres.

Annabel lleva un par de años en esta actividad  y asegura que este negocio es muy bueno y lo disfruta mucho, para proveerse de la mercadería hace  los pedidos a los distribuidores  para obtener mayores ganancias.

En esta ocasión el préstamo que esta solicitando estará destinado a la compra de mercadería para cumplir con algunos pedidos de ropa pendientes por entregar y aprovechará para abastecerse para  la época navideña con un stock surtido de ropa y cosméticos.

Annabel ya hizo realidad uno de sus sueños que era tener su propia casa y empezará a ahorrar para decorarla,  es lo único que le falta para completar su sueño.
texts.en:
Annbel Sánchez is a member of the Everes Communal Bank, located in the community of Quemado in the province of Manabí. It is a peaceful agricultural community.

Annabel is married to Jacinto, a master house builder. She is 28 years old and has 3 children aged 8 years, 6 years, and a baby of 10 months. She takes the baby with her wherever she goes.

Annabel’s business is selling clothes, such as pants, blouses, underwear and costume jewelry. She travels around the community visiting her clients, who are mostly women. She has been in business for about two years. Business has been good and she enjoys it a lot. She orders her merchandise from distributors in order to make a better profit. This loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise to fill some pending orders, and to stock up on clothing and cosmetics for the Christmas season.

Annabel has already realized one of her dreams – to have her own house. She is beginning to save to decorate the house, which is the only thing she lacks to complete her dream.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fill pending orders and buy merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for the last 30 years. He is 58 years old and married with five children. All his children are in school. His wife is a food vendor working in the community where they live. She prepares banku (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with soup and rice with stew and has been in business for the last three years.

Bernard supports his wife with the salary he receives at the end of the month from teaching. He joined this group to access a loan to help his wife increase her business and expand her working capital. Bernard is requesting a loan to assist his wife with her business progress and to take care of the children. He will be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To assist his wife with a food business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells local herbs. She prepares the herbs from roots and bark of trees mixed with some other ingredients. She sells from a van at the local market square, and she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She also supplies drug stores in her community. Comfort has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy herbs and other ingredients in bulk.

Comfort is 40 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Goaso, a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo region.

loans.use: To buy herbs

loans.name: Maria Beneranda

texts.es:
María Beneranda M. I.  es socia del Banco Comunal Everes, vive en la comunidad  de Pueblo Nuevo  en la provincia de Manabí en la costa ecuatoriana, este sector se caracteriza por ser netamente agrícola.

María lleva treinta años de casada, tiene cuatro hijos todos casados ella junto a su esposo se dedican  a la agricultura  siembran maíz, maní y yuca, siendo la mejor época el mes de enero porque empieza la temporada invernal favoreciendo a los cultivos.

El préstamo solicitado en  esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de úrea y líquidos para combatir la maleza y plagas que atacan los sembríos así como para cancelar a los jornaleros  que le ayudan a sembrar su tierra.
texts.en:
María Beneranda M. I. is a member of the Everes Communal Bank. She lives in the Pueblo Nuevo community in the Manabí province, which is on the Ecuadorian coast. This area is known for its agriculture. María has been married for 30 years, and she has four children who are all married. She and her husband are farmers. They plant corn, peanuts, and yucca. The best time to plant is January because that is when the winter season that favors these crops starts. The loan is to buy urea and liquids to combat the weeds and pests that attack the crops. This way they will not need the workers to help them with their fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy urea and fertilizers to fight the pests on their crops

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat owns a general store. She is 33 years old and married with five children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan for N100,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell in her store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a seamstress who has been sewing for three years now. She is 33 years old, divorced and has two children, both in school. She is a specialist in womens' wear. Her skills and designs are first class. She sews various styles that give her customers new looks, like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She wants to use this loan to buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: D. Aline est née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Aline vit depuis près de trente quatre ans au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou. Mariée à ANIAMBOSSOU Luc un agent de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie, Aline a à sa charge cinq enfants dont trois sont ses propres enfants. Aline n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école, mais tous ces cinq enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Aline vend depuis déjà 10 ans, des boissons (bières, sucreries de tous genre) ainsi que du riz et des tissus dans la buvette Marina à Cotonou. Aline achète ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Aline a déjà eu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Aline voudrait satisfaire plus les besoins de sa clientèle, et subvenir sans difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle envisage acheter et construire plus tard une parcelle, grâce aux économies issus des produits vendus. C'est pourquoi, Aline s'est rapproché de ALIDé pour obtenir un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Aline D. was born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For nearly 34 years, she has lived in the Gbégamey district of Cotonou. Married to Luc Aniambossou, an agent for the Société Béninoise de Brasserie, Aline has five children, three of whom are her own. Aline never had the opportunity to go to school, but all five of the children are in school. The couple shares responsibility for the family's expenses. For 10 years, Aline has sold beverages (beer and soft drinks of all types) as well as rice and fabrics in the Marina refreshment area in Cotonou. Aline buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Aline has already received two loans that she repaid in full to Alidé. Aline would like to keep up with customer demand more and take care of her children's needs with no problems. Sometime in the future she would like to purchase and build on a plot of land with the money made from selling her products. This is why Aline has gone to Alidé for help in obtaining a third loan.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cases of beverages (beers, alcoholic beverages) and bags of rice

loans.name: Ndèye Khady

texts.fr: Ndèye Khady Mané, 40 ans, mariée, 4 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de NIAFOR depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle a été 15 fois bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe une activité de vente de poisson et d'huile de palme, et les bénéfices générés lui permettent de verser une participation mensuelle de 15000 francs CFA pour les dépenses de la famille. Son objectif est d'améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et d'assurer la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Ndèye Khady Mané is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of NIAFOR for seven and a half years. She has received 15 loans and had no problems repaying them in full. She is expanding her business of selling fish and palm oil, and the profit she makes enables her to contribute 15,000 CFA francs per month toward her family's expenses. She wants to improve her family's lives and ensure that her children receive an education.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her shop

loans.name: Life Group

texts.en:
The Life Group is a group of two borrowers led by Abu K. K., who is 32 years old. Abu is married with two children, ages 2 and 6, who are in the educational level of kindergarten and first grade. He is a high school graduate but could not attend university due to lack of financial support. Abu and his family live in the Sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Abu's business is a general provisions shop. He buys general provisions wholesale and sells to the residents of Sheriff Quarter. He has been running this business for one year and is hoping to improve to a bigger store with branches around town in the future. Abu had been facing some financial problems over the last months with his business but fought hard to maintain it because it is his only means of income. He talks to his customers in a good manner in order encourage them to continue buying from him.

Abu needs this loan in order to purchase more provisional goods like vegetable oil, bath soap, cigarettes, margarine, etc., to improve business. Abu dreams of giving his children a better education and of building a big house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more provisional goods like vegetable oil, bath soap, cigarettes, margarine, etc., to improve business

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en:
Rakia is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband in taking care of the house. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. 

To support her children, she has been selling cosmetic products like sprays, powders, lip glosses, blouses, etc., through hawking. She has been in business for a year. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her children’s education. 

She is so sure that your loan support will bring her to the desired results she expects. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Sister

texts.fr: K. Sister est née vers 1969 et vit dans le quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis onze ans. Sister est divorcée et a quatre enfants tous scolarisés à sa charge, dont trois sont ses propres enfants. Sister vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Sister n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et exerce depuis dix ans la vente du riz, d’œufs et d’huile végétale qu’elle distribue. Sister fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Sister a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIdé. Pour accroître son fonds de roulement et réaliser plus d'économie afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants, Sister sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sister K. was born about 1969 and has lived in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin for the last 11 years. She is divorced and is the mother and responsible for four school aged children. Sister lives alone with her children and is solely responsible for the needs of the family. She did not have the opportunity to attend school and has been selling and distributing rice, eggs, and vegetable oil for the last ten years. Sister buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already made two loans with ALIde, which have been duly repaid. To strengthen her business operating funds, and better meet the needs of both her customers and her children, Sister is requesting this third ALIde loan.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, cans of oil and crates of eggs for resale

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata K., Mabinty K., Mariatu K. and Mariatu T.. They named their group Talapsu. For the very first time, these entrepreneurs are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leone each from Kiva lenders to enable them to improve their businesses and living standards.  

Aminata K. (on the right) is the leader of this group. She is age 28 and was born in Makeni. She is married to a lecturer and they have three children: one in secondary school, the other in primary school and the last one is not of school-going age. Aminata sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes) and shoes. Aminata has been a businesswoman for about 18 years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est marée et mère de 6 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de OUNCK depuis 6 ans et demi, elle a été à 7 reprises bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe une activité de vente de sucre et les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales
texts.en:
Mariama S. is a 44 year old woman, She is married and a mother, responsible for 6 children. Mariama has been a member of the Village Bank of Ounck for six and a half years. She has made seven business loans and has never had a problem with repayment. She started a business selling sugar and the profits earned have enabled her to contribute to the family expenses

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her small business activities

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles runs a drugstore in his community. He sells all kinds of drugs in his store by the roadside. Charles procures his goods from Kumasi and sometimes from distributors' vans. He has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to increase his stock.

Charles is 39 years old, married and has one child in school. He lives with his child and wife in a rented apartment in Goaso, a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo region.

loans.use: To stock a drugstore

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: La señora Maria Martha de 52 años de  edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos todos mayores y trabajan, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su vivienda, su esposo se desempeña como abogado, ella es gerente de una tienda de productos de limpieza desde hace seis años, el cual comenzó como vendedora, lo cual se veneficio por que los ingresos son mejores, con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, arena, hierro y otros para hacer una oficina por que su esposo alquila en otro lugar para brindar sus servicios de abogado, y a ella le conviene que lo ponga en su casa de habitación para que ahorren dinero y hay mas cuido en nuestra casa. Agradece a la institución por los financiamientos que me ha dado ya que me han sido de mucho beneficios para hacer las mejoras en mi hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Martha is 52, and she lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married, and she has three grown children who work. Her plans are to be able to finish making improvements on her house. Her husband works as a lawyer. She has worked for six years as the manager of a store selling cleaning products. She started as a seller. She has benefited because the earnings are better. With this loan she will buy construction materials like rocks, cement, sand, iron, and other things to make an office for her husband. He rents another place to provide his services as a lawyer. She sees that putting the office in their home will save them money, and their house is better kept. She is grateful to the institution for the loans they have given her. They have been very beneficial in improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build an office for her husband, a lawyer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary loves selling and has much experience in customer service. She has been selling vegetables like peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc. and dried fish for five years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of vegetables and fish from the farmers and fishmongers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from farmers and resell at higher price. She sells her produce on a tabletop. She wants to use her loan to purchase vegetables, spices and dried fish in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She makes a profit margin between 8 and 12 cedis daily.

Mary is 58 years old. She is a wife and the mother of six children. Currently, two of her children are in school. The others have completed school and are working. She believes her loan will increase her working capital to enable her to increase her profits. Mary believes in education as the best legacy she can leave her kids, and she is motivated to work for the sake of her kids. She hopes to save more money to support her kids who are in school. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and dried fish

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: C. Charlotte est née le 17 Juillet 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte réside au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou depuis trente ans. Mariée à SEMILIKO Gérard un chauffeur, Charlotte est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Cependant, Charlotte vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Charlotte a été à l'école jusqu'au secondaire et s'est ensuite mis depuis douze ans dans la vente de divers (papiers mouchoirs, savons, lait, pâte alimentaires, défrisant pour cheveux). Charlotte vend également du pétrole et des boissons locaux appelé Sodabi de façon ambulante. Charlotte fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Charlotte a obtenu auprès de ALIDé deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et les besoins de sa famille, Charlotte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Charlotte C. was born on July 17, 1979 in Cotonou, the Capital of Benin. Charlotte has lived in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou for thirty years. Married to Gerard Semiliko, a driver, Charlotte is the mother of three children who have all attended school. She lives alone with her children however, and solely supports the financial needs of the family. Charlotte attended secondary school and for the next 12 years worked at her business selling assorted products (soaps, paper napkins, milk, meat spreads, hair conditioners). She also sells fuel and local drinks called Sodabi by hawking. Charlotte buys her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has completed and repaid two previous loans with ALIde To increase her business and to better satisfy the needs of both her customers and her family, Charlotte is requesting this third loan from ALIde.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted supplies for resale (meat spreads, preserves, soaps and cans of fuel)

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is forty-three years old. She is married and has two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. 

Joyce is a trader. She trades cereals, especially maize. She supplies food vendors in her community and sells at the market square. Joyce also travels to other towns to sell on their market days. She buys her goods from nearby towns. Joyce has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Flora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Flora Áreas de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora con deseo de ayudar a su familia para que tenga una mejor por venir, desde hace veinte años palmea tortilla y hace nacatamales para vender, y poder tener sus propios ingresos, vive en Batahola Sur en la capital de Managua, procreo cuatro hijos los cuales están casados, su esposo es cadete de taxista y su horarios son de 6 de la mañana a las dos de la tarde, y cambian los horarios de la cooperativa, con este crédito desea comprar maíz en quintales, leña, frutas, verduras para variar los productos y vender mas, ya que como planes quiere hacer mejora a su vivienda. Contenta con la institución por financiamiento.
texts.en:
Flora Áreas is 48, and she is a hard-working woman. She wants to help her family have a better future. For twenty years she has been making tortillas and “nacatamales” (a type of Nicaraguan tamale) to sell in order to be able to have her own income. She lives in Batahola Sur in the capital of Managua. She has four children, and they are married. Her husband is a taxi driver. His hours are from six in the morning until two in the afternoon. The cooperative’s schedule changes. With this loan she wants to buy corn by the quintal (100 pounds), wood, fruit, and vegetables to vary the products and sell more. Her plan is that she wants to improve her home. She is happy with the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu is a teacher in the community where he lives. To survive on his monthly salary alone is not enough. Therefore, he runs a video center to augment his income. His video center is patronized by schoolchildren during their less busy hours. He has games like spelling bees, PlayStation, etc. in stock. He started this business a year ago. He requests a loan to buy more educational games to entertain school kids when they are less busy for additional income.

Abu is 32 years old, married and the father of a child who is in school. Abu would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy video games and educational games for kids

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria Isabel Pérez de 48 años de edad, vive en la comarca las sierrita de Santo Domingo de la iglesia católica 2 Km. al sur, casada procreo cuatro hijos los cuales, tres trabajan como jardinero, el menor estudia, su esposo trabaja como jardinero y se lleva  a sus hijos para que aprendan el oficio y puedan tener como ganarse la vida honradamente, su negocio es la venta de tortilla, cosa de horno,  venta de carne de cerdo, el cual lleva doce años en las ventas, en ocasiones las ventas bajas pero se vende. Es su segundo crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, y carne de cerdo para vender más sus productos y tener materia prima en su inventario. A agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de que le ha dado para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel Pérez, 48, lives in the Las Sierrita de Santo Domingo region 2 km. south of the Catholic church. She is married and has four children. Three of the children work as gardeners, and the youngest is in school. Her husband works as a gardener. He takes the children with him so that they can learn the job and be able to earn a living honorably. Her business is selling tortillas, baked goods, and pork. She has been in sales for twelve years. Sometimes sales are down, but she sells. This is her second loan, which she will use to buy corn, wood, and pork. She will do this to sell more products and to have raw materials in her inventory. She is grateful to the institution for the opportunity it has given her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood, and pork to sell

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
This is Abibatu K., Mariatu K., Adama K. and Sallay Baieru of the Wan Word group. Their leader is Abibatu K. on the left. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00 for each to enable them buy more goods to sell. With more goods at their disposal, they will be able to make more profit and thus improve in their livelihoods. 

Their leader is now approximately twenty-six years old, she is divorced with one child who is in class one. Abibatu sells clothes and slippers/flip flops. She has been a businesswoman for six years now. With this loan, she will be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 33 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, who are all in school. Rebecca lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. 

She is a trader of onions. She sells on a tabletop at the local market square and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Rebecca buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of onions in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: F. Françoise est née le 04 Juin 1967 et vit depuis huit ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADE Victorin, Françoise est mère d'un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  N'ayant pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école, Françoise vend depuis douze ans de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) en gros, ainsi que des divers (tomates, riz, pâte alimentaire, etc.) dans son quartier. Françoise fait ses emplettes à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Françoise est un ancien client de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'étendre son activité pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et réaliser plus d'économies, Françoise sollicite à nouveau auprès de ALIDé un crédit.
texts.en:
Françoise F. was born on 4 June 1967 and has lived for eight years in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Victorin Ade, Françoise has one child who is not yet in school. The couple provides for the family together. Not having had the chance to go to school, Françoise has sold akassa (a local food made from corn starch) in bulk, as well as other items (tomatoes, rice, food pastes, etc.) for twelve years in her locality. Françoise makes her purchases at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Françoise is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and has repaid her loans properly. With a view to extend her business so as to satisfy the demands of her clientele and to realize more savings, Françoise is seeking a new loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (canned food, food paste, rice, tomatoes)

loans.name: Marcos Roberto

texts.es: El señor Marcos López de 43 años, vive en Ciudadela Nicaragua en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 8 años de  edad que cursa su primaria, don Marcos es dueño de un taxi el cual ha trabajado por doce años, este vehiculo lo compro con dinero de su liquidación que trabajaba en jaboneria el hogar, su meta es comprar otro carro moderno en donde pueda seguir dando su servicio al cliente, con este préstamo hará mejora  a su casa, va a construir las paredes de concreto para una mejor infraestructura como mejor seguridad familiar contra la delincuencia. Agradece AFodenic por dar el financiamiento para seguir con sus objetivos en mejorar cada día su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos L., who is 43 years old, lives in Nicaragua's capital city of Managua. He is married, and his wife has an 8-year old child to whom she primarily attends. Mr. Marcos is the owner of a taxi, where he has worked for twelve years. This vehicle was purchased with money from the sale of his homemade soap business. His goal is to buy another modern car where he can continue to provide customer service. This loan will improve his home too where he will build concrete walls for better infrastructure and better security against crime. He thanks AFODENIC for giving him the loan to pursue his goals of improving his home each day.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build concrete walls

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She sometimes sells through hawking. She is 37 years old and divorced with three children. All her children are in school. She is supportive to her family through the proceeds she makes from the business. She has two years of experience selling but progress has persistently been slow due to insufficient funds. 

She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a profit that is more viable. She wants to purchase bulk quantities of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk quantity of Dumas clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Jesus Te Amo Group

texts.es:
María S.  de 42 años muy temprano se levanta los días martes y viernes para vender su  mercadería, es decir,  verduras en la zona de Alto Lima,  está con su grupo  aproximadamente 2 años,  recuerda que con su primer préstamo compró mercadería para emprender su negocio, ahora necesita un poco más ya que su venta ha incrementado porque ha conseguido clientes que le piden mayores productos, es así que necesita el préstamo para seguir comprando  mercadería como alverja y zanahoria, ella compra su mercadería de la Ceja ciudad de El Alto.
María es madre de 3 niños a quienes les hace seguimiento en sus labores escolares.
Maria pertenece al grupo Jesús te Ama que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, sus compañeras también tiene sus negocios como la venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de juguetes, bolsas plásticas, muebles, chocolate, ropa y costura de pollera (falda).
Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería o materia prima.
texts.en:
María S. is 42. She gets up very early on Tuesdays and Fridays to sell her merchandise, vegetables, in the Alto Lima region. She has been in her group for approximately two years. She remembers that she used her first loan to buy merchandise to start her business. Now she needs a little more because her sales have increased. She has obtained customers who ask her for more products. That is why she needs a loan to be able to keep buying merchandise like peas and carrots. She buys her merchandise in the city of Ceja in El Alto. María has three children who are in school. María belongs to the Jesús te Ama Group, which is part of the German Busch community center. Her colleagues also have businesses like selling “chuño” (dried potato), selling toys, plastic bags, furniture, chocolate, clothing, and making “polleras” (skirts). All of them need a loan to buy merchandise or raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region.

Mary is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She sells on a tabletop at the local market square and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She sometimes hawks and supplies to food vendors in her community. Mary buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Martina Martha

texts.es: Es cliente antigua, se encuentra atravesando la sexta secuencia trabajando junto a nuestra institucion, durante sus creditos nunca presento problema alguno demostrando en todo momento sera una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de seguir adelante.  Doña Martha tiene estabilidad domiciliaria ya que la misma vive en casa familiar con sus dos hijas.  El crédito será destinado en la compra de carne y en el cambio de cuchillos que son utilizados diariamente en su puesto de carniceria del cual es dueña y se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Yungas en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
She is an old client, and is now working for the sixth time with our institution. Over the course of her loans, she has never presented any problems, and she has proved herself to be a hard working woman with a desire to succeed. Sra. Martha has a stable home, as she lives with her two daughters. This loan will be used for the purchase of meat and knives that will be used daily in her butcher shop that she owns in the Yungas Market in the city center.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of goods and in the purchase of knives to cut meat

loans.name: Teresita Del Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresita del Jesús I. N. es socia del Banco Comunal Everes ubicado  en la comunidad de Palo  Quemado en la provincia de Manabí un lugar tranquilo donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura.

Teresita está casada hace 22 años vive junto a su esposo y dos nietas que las crió desde muy pequeñitas porque su hija falleció hace nueve años asumiendo ella la responsabilidad de cuidar a las niñas.

Teresita debe distribuir su tiempo entre los quehaceres del hogar, el cuidado de sus nietas, su criadero de gallinas criollas, además todos los días debe trasladarse a Portoviejo porque trabaja en casa de un familiar haciendo la limpieza y cuidando dos niños pequeños hasta las tres de la tarde. 

Teresita y su esposo comparten actividades en su pequeña granja,  sobre todo él se encarga de comprar los pollos para la cría,  con el nuevo préstamo que recibirán de la Fundación  van a  comprar más pollos,  alimentos  como maíz, balanceado y además vacunas y vitaminas para su crianza.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresita de Jesús I. N. is a member of the Everes Community Bank, located in the community of Palo Quemado, in the Manabí province, a quiet place where people are in the agriculture industry. Teresita has been married for 22 years and lives with her husband and two granddaughters who she has raised since they were small, since her daughter passed away nine years ago and she took responsibility for caring for the girls. Teresita distributes her time between household duties, caring for her granddaughters, raising her Creole chickens, and every day she also travels to Portoviejo because she works in a house where she does the cleaning and cares for the children until three in the afternoon. Teresita and her husband share the activities in their small farm, wherein he buys the chickens. With the loan from the Foundation, they will be able to buy more chicken, food such as corn, balance and vaccines and vitamins for chickens' growth.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, food such as corn, balance, vaccines and vitamins for her animals.

loans.name: Sabenti Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Sabenti Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (or Le 500,000 for each) for the first time from SMT/Kiva in order to help themselves improve their businesses and living conditions.

Abu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of the group. Abu was born in a village call Yele in the Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. He is approximately 55 years of age. Abu is married with four children. His wife is a businesswoman and the children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Abu sells used clothes and has been in the business for more than 25 years.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Maria Sonia Patricia

texts.es: La señora María Sonia es ya mayor de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo, tienen 2 hijos uno mujer y uno hombre los cuales también viven con ella,  la hija esta trabajando en una empresa de la ciudad y ayuda a su mamá  con los gastos de la casa, el otro hijo estudia la preparatoria es por ello que con este crédito la señora María Sonia lo necesita para el pago de inscripción de su hijo en la preparatoria, también para comprar uniformes que este requiere y desea comprarle una computadora usada ya que en esta etapa escolar es mas utilizado este equipo de computo, y mas que nada  para que su hijo siga estudiando ya que quiere que salga adelante y pueda ser un profesionista pues ella no tubo el dinero y el apoyo cuando chica para seguir estudiando quiere que sus hijos si lo realicen.
texts.en:
Sra. María Sonia is now an older woman, and lives with her husband. They have one daughter and one son, who also lives with them. The daugher is working in a company in the city and helps her mother with the household expenses, and their son studies in prep school. It is for him that Sra. María Sonia needs the loan, to be able to pay tuition for her son's school. She will also use it to purchase uniforms that the school requires, and wants to buy a used computer because in this stage of his schooling he must use the computer. More than anything it will be used so that her son will continue to study, since he wants to succeed and be a professional; she did not have the money or support when she was young to continue to study and she wants her children to be able to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of school tuition, purchase of uniforms and a used computer

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: C. Martine est née en 1961 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Martine vit depuis environs 48 ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou. Martine est mariée à ASSOGBA Firmin un maçon, et a sept enfants, dont six sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants de Martine sont scolarisés. Martine et firmin supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. N'ayant pas été à l'école, Martine a commencé très tôt le commerce. Martine vend en effet depuis trente ans des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, gombo, piments, oignons, etc.), et aussi du charbon de bois et de l'akassa (aliment fait à base d'amidon de maïs) dans son quartier. Martine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Bohicon au Bénin. Martine a déjà eu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Pour accroître son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et d'assurer l'avenir de ses enfants, Martine sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Martine C. was born in 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Martine has lived for about 48 years in the Cadjehoun area of Cotonou. Martine is married to Firmin Assogba, a mason, and she has seven children, six of whom are in her care. All of Martine's children are in school. Martine and Firmin provide for the family together. Not having gone to school, Martine began in business very early on. In fact, for thirty years, Martine has been selling sauce ingredients (fresh tomatoes, okra, spices, onions) and also charcoal and akassa (a food made of corn starch) in her area. Martine obtains her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and in Bohicon in Benin. Martine has already had two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. To increase her working capital in order to better satisfy her customers and assure her children's future, Martine is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sauce ingredients (fresh tomatoes, onions, spices) and bags of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase four calves to raise

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Gregoria Hernández de 47 años de edad, reside en Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, procreo dos hijos de 16 y 18 años ambos estudiantes de la secundaria, su esposo es comerciante, ella lleva diez años en la venta de comida,  abecés las ventas están buenas y otra bajas pero logra sastifacer sus necesidades día a día. Cuando inicio lo hizo con fondos  en Afodenic el cual hasta ahora se ha beneficiado para aumentar sus ventas y da las gracias por la oportunidad de promover a mucha familias Nicaragüenses, a que puedan comenzar a trabajar independientemente en el comercio. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, ropa variada y zapatos para obtener variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Gregoria Hernández is 47 years old and lives in Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua. She has two children (ages 18 & 16) who are both high school students. Her husband works as a merchant. Gregoria has been selling food for 10 years. Sometimes business is good. At other times, sales are low yet she manages to meet her daily needs.

As a result of receiving funds from AFODENIC, her sales have increased. She is thankful the organization provides assistance to many Nicaraguan families so that they can work independently in their trades. Gregoria will use her loan to buy basic grains, clothing, and shoes so that she will have a variety of products to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, clothing, & shoes

loans.name: Adigozal

texts.en:
Adigozal Z. is a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and farming. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed on his property.

His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. He is requesting a second loan from KIVA and AqroInvest. Adigozal successfully repaid his first loan.

loans.use: Purchase four calves to breed

loans.name: Memsu Group

texts.en:
This is Matina B. B., Isatu J. and Mariatu T.. They named their group Memsu, a Temne phrase meaning “Try Us.” They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make better sales and consequently, improve their living standards. With the profit they make, they can better look after themselves and their children. They will use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They will also use it to feed and clothe themselves and their children. To achieve these goals, they are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones for each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Matina B. B. (right) is the leader of the group. She is 40 years of age. She was born in Makeni. Matina is married with two children, who are attending secondary and primary schools. Matina is a teacher who supplements her teaching profession with some petty trading. She sells market food, sugar, cigarettes and “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes). She has been doing business for five years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell hair extensions

loans.name: Bakhshali

texts.en:
Bakhshali N. is 47 years old. He is married and has four children. Since he was very young, he has been in the business of raising and selling cattle, which is why he has a lot of experience. He has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by AqroInvest Credit Union. He received a loan that he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their area.

Today, Bakhshali has once again come to AqroInvest Credit Union for a loan to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase four young bulls

loans.name: Fakhrat

texts.en:
Cattle farming is an economic activity dedicated to raising animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Fakhrat T. has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He's married and has 2 children that, in Fakhrat’s words, are his reason for living. It should be said that the low income available to people in this rural area isn't enough to maintain a family.

For this reason, Fakhrat works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his wife and children. Fakhrat urgently needs to buy cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of 1600 AZN. Be an important part of the growth of Fakhrat’s business.

loans.use: Purchase cows and calves to raise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Rosina is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also hawks the bread (sells door-to-door) in her community. Rosina buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maritza I. P. es socia del Banco Comunal Everes, este banco está  situado en la comunidad de Palo  Quemado  en la provincia de Manabí en la región costa del  Ecuador, aquí la mayoría de su  gente se dedica a la agricultura.

Maritza es casada  y madre de 3 hijos,  distribuye su tiempo entre los quehaceres del hogar y en el taller de mecánica   que tienen con su esposo desde hace dos años,   el taller está ubicado en casa de la madre de  Maritza. 

El préstamo solicitado a la Fundación  es para invertir en  la compra  de  repuestos como  pernos, liquido de frenos, grasas, bandas, aceites, electrodos y pinturas para  abastecer su taller así,  como  también para solventar en algo los estudios de su esposo que desea obtener su título de mecánico automotriz para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza I. P. is a member of the Everes Communal Bank which is in Palo Quemado. This community is located in the province of Manabi, which lies in the coastal region of Ecuador. The majority of the residents are involved in agriculture. Maritza is married and the mother of 3 children. She divides her time between performing household chores and managing the mechanic’s shop her husband started two years ago. The business is located at her mother’s house. The loan she is requesting from Fundación ESPOIR will be used to buy bolts, brake fluid, grease, belts, motor oil, electrodes, and paints to stock her husband’s repair shop. Part of the money will also be used to pay for additional training for her husband so that he can become a certified auto mechanic and provide better service to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase auto supplies for her husband's repair shop & pay for his certification training

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.en: Martha Isabel M. S. is 53 years old Both of her children are grown and have married. She meets the demands of the lunch crowd at a large central market in Nicaragua. She inherited her business from her mother about four years ago, but grew up learning from her mom and assisting in the family business. Martha dreams of having a space dedicated entirely to her business where she would be able to expand the products she offers and be able to earn more for her family. This isn’t her first loan with Fundacion Leon 2000. She has a good credit history and a strong relationship with the organization.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en:
Marifat M. is a small producer in the small village of Imishli city. He and his father have been raising sheep for 10 years. This provides the income that allows him to feed his parents and build a future for a future family. He decided to raise sheep because it is a very profitable business and people in Azerbaijan use meat in their meals every day.

Marifat has asked for this loan to buy more sheep in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell cosmetics

loans.name: Samaya

texts.en:
Samaya K. is a hard-working person and over many years, she has earned enough income to help her husband with family expenses. She has 3 children who provide the meaning of her life. She is devoted to raising animals, especially the cows which she buys and, after fattening, sells in the local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs.

In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Samaya is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase calves. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, earn more, and meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: Purchase four calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Money Finders Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Money Finder loan group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs due to the lack of sufficient capital. Therefore, they came to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them expand their businesses.

Esther K. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Esther was born in Makeni. She is thirty-five years old and married, and has three children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II) and the other is in class one. 

Esther sells soap as her primary business, but she also sells items like oil, jeans, skirts, and trousers.  She has been a businesswoman for more than ten years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Lukaia

texts.en:
Lukaia is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. All of her children are currently independent. She lives with her husband in a small village in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Lukaia sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about thirty years ago to take care of her entire family. Her food production is on a small scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and rice to increase her efficiency and enable her to produce her stew in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, vegetables, meat, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pregnant cows to increase income

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Faustina sells food, such as cassava and plantains. She supplies food vendors in her community and also sells at the market square. Faustina also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Doña  Candida 46 años de edad, reside en el barrio Raspan Norte en la capital de Managua, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 15 y 19 años los cuales trabajan para apoyarla, se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos como: perfúmenes, pinturas, shampoo y otros, vende al contado y al crédito, las dificultades que se le dan es cuando los clientes no pagan entonces pierde su inversión,  cuando inicio lo hizo con fondos en bancos comunales ,lo que mas desea es tener su propia tienda y obtener mejores ingresos. Con este préstamo comparara cosméticos, perfumenes para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad. Una de sus proyectos es poder mejorar su vivienda. Contenta con el financiamiento que la institución ha dado.
texts.en:
Doña Candida is 46 years old and lives in the Raspan Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is a single mother of two children (ages 19 and 15) who also work to support her. Candida sells cosmetics such as perfumes, nail polishes, shampoos, and other products. Her sales are made for cash and on credit. Difficulties arise when she loses money because customers do not pay.

When she started working with communal banks, Candida wanted to open her own shop so that she could generate a better income. With this loan, she will buy cosmetics and perfumes so that she can offer her customers a wider variety. One of her goals is to begin home improvements. She is satisfied with the financing the Institution has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & perfumes

loans.name: Marla Maria
