texts.es: La señora Marla R. de 38 años de edad, vende refrescos y ropa de segunda mano desde hace cinco años, anteriormente tenia una pulpería pero por las ventas baja quebró y solo se quedo vendiendo refrescos, procreo tres hijos de 13,16 y18 años dos estudian y el mayor hace sus trabajo como albañil para apoyar  a sus hermanos que estudien, su papa no esta con ellos pero les ayuda económicamente con los gastos mensuales, lo que mas desea es poder a comenzar con su pulpería es por eso que invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, productos lácteos, y otros para comenzar con su venta. Es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic y agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de financiar con 24,500 a un plazo de doce meses que será de gran beneficio para comenzar a trabajar en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Marla R. is 38 years old and for the past five years has sold soft drinks and used clothing. Prior to this she had a grocery store but, due to poor sales, it went bankrupt and she only kept the soft drink sales activity. She has three children, ages 13, 16 and 18; two are still students and the eldest works as a laborer to help his siblings who are still in school. Their father does not live with them but he does help financially with monthly expenses. What she would like most is to start up her grocery store again so this loan will be used to purchase inventory: basic grains, snacks, dairy products and other supplies to start her sales. This is her fifth cycle with Afodenic and she is grateful to the institution for the opportunity to borrow 24,500 over a 12 month period which will be of great help for her to start her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase staples, snacks and dairy products.

loans.name: Na We Dae Try Group

texts.en:
Here are Mohamed K., Aminata C., and Zainab C.. They call their group "Na We Dae Try." This will be the first loan this group is borrowing from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each of the members. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses by adding more goods. This will enable them earn more profits so that they can better meet their children’s academic, nutritional, and medical needs. 

Mohamed K. (in the middle in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Matotoka, in Tonkolili district in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children together. Their two oldest children are in classes five and three, respectively. The youngest is not yet old enough for school. Mohamed sells palm-oil, the most popular cooking oil in Sierra Leone, and has been in this business for six years.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina C. de 48 años de edad, su negocio es la elaboración de cosa de horno, las famosas rosquillas que desde joven hace ya que era como se ganaba la vida su mama, y ahí aprendió ya que ayudaba a preparar las ricas rosquillas, ella lleva varios ciclos en Afodenic el cual ha invertido en materia prima como en mejora a su vivienda, vive en Sabana Grande, como objetivo es mejorar su vivienda, con este crédito reparara el horno en donde prepara los hornados ya que   tiene que darle mantenimiento ya que día por medio horna. El cual entrega  a sus clientes como la venta ambulantes  de las rosquilla.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Argentina C. is 48 years old and her business is in baked goods, producing the famous rosquillas (donuts which are the specialty baked good in Nicaragua). She’s been baking them since her youth, as this was how her mother earned her living. She has had several loans with Afodenic which she’s invested in prime materials for home improvements. She lives in Sabana Grande and her goal is to continue to improve her home. With this loan she will repair the oven in which she bakes her rosquillas, which she delivers to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair her oven

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Here are Gbassay C., Posseh B. and Kadiatu K.. They call their group "Sorbeh," a Temne word, meaning “hard work.” They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and improve their standards of living. 

Gbassay C. (on the right in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Gbassay was born in Port Loko, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is now twenty-nine years old. She is married to a driver and they have one child who is in class six. Gbassay C. sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil in Sierra Leone) and “gara lapper” (locally-dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs). She has five years of experience in this trade.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To strengthen her small business

loans.name: Yubania

texts.es: La señora Yubania A. de 36 años de edad, se dedica al lavado y planchado desde hace siete años es la forma de estar en su casa y pode cuidar a su hija de 10 años de  edad la cual va a clase, su esposo es mariachi el cual sale por las noche en la rotonda de Bello Horizonte una zona de la capital en donde están los músicos que alegran a los Managuas, sus planes es mejorar su vivienda hacerle las mejoras para darle a su familia seguridad, ella vive en un barrio llamado Laureles Norte, lleva cuatro ciclo en la institución y muy sastifecha por los logros, con este crédito repara su cerco y hará un pequeño muro para mejor seguridad de su vivienda. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los créditos que han sido en gran beneficio.
texts.en:
Yubania A. is 36. She has been working at washing and ironing for seven years. It is a way of being at home and being able to take care of her ten year old daughter. Her daughter goes to school. Her husband is a mariachi. At night he goes to the Bello Horizonte rotunda in the capital. That is where all the musicians who make the Managuans happy are. Her plan is to improve her home by making some improvements to give her family security. She lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte. She is in her fourth cycle with the institution. She is very satisfied with the achievements. She will use this loan to fix a fence and build a small wall for better security for her home. She is grateful to Afodenic for the help with the loans, which have been of great benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a small wall

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou Diédhiou est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans et a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de d'huile de palme et de jus de citron. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
Aïssatou Diédhiou is 41 years old, she is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member for seven years of the Banc Villageois (or "Village Bank") of TENGHORY DIAMALAYE and has been the benficiary of 14 loans which she has always repayed without any difficulty. She is developing a small business selling palm oil and citrus juice. The profits she makes will help her support her husband and to take care of her family. Aïssatou Diédhiou est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans et a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de d'huile de palme et de jus de citron. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help promote her business selling palm oil and citrus juice.

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
Here are Zainab K., Hawa M. and Kadiatu S. of the "Peace and Unity" loan group. They are small-scale businesswomen from the northern City of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick. 

Zainab K. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-two year old and is married to a monthly wage earner. They have three children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School II, the other is in class VI and the other in class IV. Zainab sells sardines, powdered milk, books, cigarettes, and so on. She has been in a businesswoman for six years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell aluminium cookware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Honest Debt Must Be Paid Group

texts.en:
Here are Mariatu K., Adama Y. K., and Adama K.. They named their group "Honest Debt Must Be Paid."  They are small-scale entrepreneurs from Makeni City who want a loan of Le 1,500,000 to enable them improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be borrowing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, improve their sales, thereby, improve their sales-to-profit-margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and children.  

Mariatu Conteh  is the leader of this group. Mariatu  was born in Sanda, one of several villages very close to Makeni. She is now age thirty and married to a businessman. They have three children. One child is in class four, the other in class three, and the youngest is too young for school. Mariatu sells used clothes for men and women. Mariatu has had more than five years of experience in this business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mabel Group

texts.en:
Here are Soneta K., Mabinty K., Marie K., and Mabinty K.. These are small-scale entrepreneurs from the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of Le 500,000.00 each to enable them add more goods into their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuits. 

Soneta K. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. She is thirty years of age and was born in Makeni city. She is married to a well digger and they have two children together. Soneta has been a businesswoman for three years. She sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, pepper, and several other locally produced goods.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Aïssatou Ibrahima

texts.fr: Aïssatou Ibrahima D. est une femme de 64 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle a eu à y bénéficier de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de pâte d'arachide et d'oignon. Elle contribue à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Aïssatou Ibrahima D. is 64 years old, married and the mother of 10 children. She has been a member for seven years of the Banc Villageois (or "Village Bank") of TENGHORY DIAMALAYE. She has been the beneficiary of 14 loans that she has always repayed without any diffculty. She is currently developing a small business selling dough made from peanut and onion. She helps contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small business

loans.name: Mammy Group

texts.en:
Here are Mohamed F. and Musa T.. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them add more goods into their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profits. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuits. 

Mohamed F. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Mohamed is forty years of age. He was born in Makeni. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children, three in secondary schools and one in primary school. Mohamed has been a businessman for over twenty years. He sells used clothing – window cottons, bed sheets, towels, handkerchiefs etc.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou N., 41 ans, mariée, avec 8 enfants dont 5 scolarisés est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec son crédit elle va continuer à développer son activité de restauration et les bénéfices générés lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou N. is 41 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom are in school. She has been a member of the Village Bank named TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for the past seven years. She has benefitted from 14 loans, all of which she has reimbursed without any difficulties. With this loan, she will continue to develop her retail business and use the profits to support her husband in caring for their family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her retail business

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.en: For years, Juan Alberto T. has dedicated himself to the sale of natural medicines. He purchases his products, including teas, salves, and herbs, from the market in Managua. He has clients in the nearby cities of Leon and Chinandega. Juan Alberto also sells his medicines to pharmacies. He has a motorbike to ensure his transportation from place to place. It is also more economical than using a car. Juan has three children ages 13, 16, and 19. All of them are currently in school. The oldest child attends the university. Juan Alberto’s partner is a housewife. He dreams of having a great pharmacy filled with many medicinal products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ta Try Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen from the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT for the very first time to seek a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of Le 500,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, and feeding and clothing them. 

Baromi B. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. She was born in Matotoka Village in northern Sierra Leone, about twenty-seven years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Two of her children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools. Baromi sells market food – rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, pepper, onions, and so on. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Baromi will invest this loan in her business by buying more of the same goods to add to her current stock of goods.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mercida

texts.en: Mercidia E. G. is 58 years old. Her six children are all grown; they range in age from 25 to 40 years old. Mercidia sells clothing for men and women. She has been in the business for 25 years. She chose this type of business because it ensured that her children were well care for. Mercidia is a long-standing client of Fundacion Leon 2000 and reports that their credit services have helped her greatly.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ta Ram Group

texts.en:
Here are Maseray K., Mariatu F. and Mabinty C.. They named their group "Ta Ram," a Temne phrase meaning “Let us pay back”. They are small-scale businesswomen from Makeni City who want a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that they can attract more customers, make better sales, earn more profits and improve their living standards. 

Maseray K. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of the group. Maseray was born in a place call Masinra in Northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have four children. Maseray and husband work very hard to look after their children who still attending schools. All of their children attend primary schools, except for the youngest, who is still too young for school. Maseray sells market food: rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and much more. Maseray has been a businesswoman for more than eight years.

loans.use: Invest In Her Business

loans.name: Las Intelectuales 3 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of the group called "Las Intelectuales" (The Intellectuals). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR. Her group is based in the area surrounding La Romana, an agricultural area where the economy focuses around the sugar cane harvest, where running water is unreliable and not potable, and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home as a single mother with her two children.

If you have ever wondered where clothing that the Salvation Army cannot sell ends up, Rosa's business can provide part of the answer. Rosa intends to use the money to buy "paca de ropa" or packages of  used clothes, which are sold in bulk after being shipped to the DR from wealthier countries. She intends to use her first loan to invest in this business and sell the clothes in her neighborhood. Its a good business and she expects the profits to allow her to provide for her children's school supplies and to keep expanding her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy packages of used clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata D. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle a tojours été fidèle aux remboursements de ses prêts. Elle développe une activité de vente d'huile de palme et de balais. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de prendre en charge certains besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aminata D. is a 40 year old woman, married, and cares for five children who all attend school. She has been a member of the village bank named TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for the past seven years. She has always reimbursed her loans on time. She has developed a retail activity to sell palm oil and brooms. Profits from these sales will allow her to take charge of certain needs of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her retail activity

loans.name: Tamarsu Group

texts.en:
Here are Mary K., Rugiatu C., Nancy K. and Rugiatu S.. They named their group "Tamarsu," a Temne word for “Help Us.” This is their first loan from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses and make enough profits to look after themselves and children.

Mary K. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of this group. Mary was born in Sanda in Northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-five years old, married to a teacher, and they have two children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School III and the other is in class four. Mary has had four years of experience in the business of selling cooked foufou (food made from pounded cassava roots), vegetables, and meat.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Juana Maria O. has a ten year old son who is in school, she is not married. Her business is the sale of fire wood and bananas from her horse drawn cart. The business began nine years ago when she needed to find a way to increase her income and support her household. Juana Maria says that this loan will help her to improve her business. She dreams of being able to afford better tools for wood working, which would also come in handy for improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wood and better tools to improve her home and business

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy C. est une femme de 63 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont les 2 fréquentent l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 1 an et demi et y a bénéficié de 3 prêts. cette fois-ci elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra de poursuivre son activité de vente de poisson séché afin de se procurer des bénéfices qui l'aideront à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy C. is a 63 year old woman, married, and a mother of four children, of whome two are currently in school. She has been a member of the village bank named TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for the past year and a half and has benefitted from three loans. She is asking for another loan to enable her to strengthen her retail activity of selling dried fish. She will use the profits to help support her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her retail activity of selling dried fish

loans.name: Lucrecia Clementina

texts.en:
Lucrecia Clementina Q. is married and has two children 16 and 19. The eldest is getting married and has suspended studies, though the younger one is still in school. Lucrecia’s primary business is the sale of various juices and soft drinks, additionally, she sells foods typical to Nicaraguans, plates with yucca and pork. Lucrecia dreams of the continued improvement of her business as a way to provide improvements to her home, like adding brick walls and a floor.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: José Darío

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor José Darío C. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de verduras comercializadas por él mismo en su establecimiento donde ofrece los productos en especifico los tomates los cuales son muy vendidos puesto que los vende a buen precio ya que son tomates de calidad.

La solicitud del crédito la ha realizado para la compra de las verduras y tomates y es por este motivo que espera ser beneficiado  para así continuar en su actividad y generar los ingresos para su beneficio.
texts.en:
José Darío C. tends his business of selling vegetables in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. In his establishment he offers products like tomatoes. He sells lots of tomatoes because he sells them at a good price and they are good quality. He has asked for a loan to buy vegetables and tomatoes. That is why he hopes to receive a loan to continue in this activity and to generate income for his benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Boumba

texts.fr: Boumba est une femme de 63 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 6 ans, elle y a reçu 12 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Elle développe un petit commerce de pâte d'arachide, elle s'approvisionne au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires pour en suite revendre dans son quartier. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Boumba is 63 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member for six years of the Banc Villageois (or "Village Bank") of TENGHORY DIAMALAYE. She has recieved 12 loans and has always successfully repayed them. She is developing a small business selling dough made from peanuts. She buys provisions at weekly markets and then returns to her own district. The profits she makes will help her to take care of her childrens' needs.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 29-year-old married father of two boys who runs a retail shop where he sells groceries and household items like sugar, tea leaves, cereals, mboga (greens), paraffin, soda, and ngano (wheat flour). He has been in this business for two years. Previously, he worked as the manager in a supermarket. He earns extra income from small-scale farming of maize, beans, oranges, and mangoes and also by providing services, such as landscaping, water harvesting, and construction.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 to increase his shop's stock of consumer goods. He hopes to achieve financial stability through savings and access to loans. He wants to enjoy the fruits of hard work and be an example of an individual with a saving culture and discipline. He will use any profits from his business to expand his shop, save for his children's education, and help others. He describes himself as a true beneficiary of Faulu and Kiva.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Lidia Sumelda

texts.en: Lidia Sumelda S. Guiterrez has four grown children who all are married and gainfully employed. Her husband is a contractor for a local refinery. It is at this refinery that Lidia maintains her business. She began by selling only refreshments. Then, she expanded her services to include lunch items and fresh produce. She dreams of having a more established presence with fixtures to best display and protect her products. This loan will get her a little closer to this dream with the purchase of more produce and a few tables and chairs to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 1,2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Antonia is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Señor (Help us, God), and her story is representative of her group. and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the Dominican Republic. Her group is based in areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy focuses on sugar cane, where running water is not potable, and electricity is unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her three dependents and her husband.

Antonia is excited to have successfully repaid her firS.loan without incident, and Esperanza is excited to extend her another one and see her continue to expand her food business. While she focuses primarily on fried foods and empanadas, with this new loan, she plans to expand into ice cream and sweets. She sees a market for these items and believes the increased profits will help her pay to transport for her children to school and to continue to expand her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Flour, sugar, cooking oil, ice cream components and coconuts.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 31 year old father of two. He supplies electricity to the residents of the Kayaba part of the Mukuru slums and also sells kerosene. He has been in this business for five years and hopes to own Matatus (public service vehicles) in the next ten years. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add to his stock of kerosene. He describes himself as social and jovial.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to stock of kerosene

loans.name: Diabou

texts.fr: Diabou LÔ est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe une activité de vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois. Elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Diabou LÔ is a 53-year-old woman who is married and the mother of nine children, all attending school. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for seven years and has obtained from it fourteen loans, which she repaid without a problem. She is developing a business selling firewood and charcoal. She helps her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small-scale business

loans.name: Sarita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sarita  está conformado por Rosa del Carmen G., María José C. G. y Anielka Jahoska M. L., ellas son de Nindiri. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora G. de veintinueve años de edad, quien vende cosméticos y joyas de plata y oro.

Mientras G. vende cosméticos y M. tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ellas necesitan el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Sarita Group is comprised of Rosa del Carmen G., María José C. G. and Anielka Jahoska M. L.. They are from Nindiri. Mrs. G. is the coordinator of the group. She is 29, and she sells cosmetics and gold and silver jewelry. María José C. G. sells cosmetics. Anielka Jahoska M. L. has a small mini-market. They need a loan to be able to buy raw materials for each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and silver and gold jewelry

loans.name: La Nueva Union 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Germania is the group coordinator of her group, La Nueva Union (the New Union), and her story is representative of both the members of her group and also of Esepranza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whome recently emigrated from the DR to Haiti) clients. Her group is based in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy is based on the sugarcane industry and where there is little access to running water (none of which is potable) or stable electricity. Here she makes her home with her two children and husband.

Germania has proven herself to be an excellent client of Esperanza and she has successfully repaid three loans already. With this new loan, she will purchase clothing in bulk to sell and bed coverings. She has identified a market for these goods among her neighbors and she believes the increased profits will allow her to buy school supplies for her kids and continue to increase her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bed coverings and clothing to sell

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
La señora Daysi M. se ha desempañado en la actividad de venta de perecederos como lo son frutas y verduras las que son comercializadas en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua donde a diario oferta las verduras y frutas a sus clientes que le visitan por ser ella una dama muy trabajadora y muy peculiar en su trabajo.

Ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas y verduras por lo que espera que dicho crédito le sea proporcionado para así dar lugar a la compra del producto y mejorar las condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
Daysi M. sells perishables like fruits and vegetables. She sells them in the Mayoreo Market in Managua. Everyday she offers fruit and vegetables to the customers who visit her. She is a very hard-working lady, and she is very particular in her work. She is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables. She hopes she receives the loan so that she can buy the products and improve the condition of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou F., 38 ans, mariée, avec 3 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle a eu à y bénéficier de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Avec son crédit elle va développer une activité de vente de pâte d'arachide, d'huile de palme et de jus de citron. Elle participe beaucoup à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou F., aged 38, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for two and a half years and has benefited from five loans there, which she always repaid successfully. With her loan, she is going to develop a business selling peanut butter, palm oil, and lemon juice. She does a lot to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her small-scale business

loans.name: Josefa Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Josefa del Socorro M. Jiménez tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de un año de edad. Josefa se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, los cuales vende en su casa y también distribuye de manera ambulante a personas cercanas. Es importante mencionar que, ya la señora tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio vendiendo poca cantidad de mercancías, debido a que lógicamente no tenía la clientela necesaria, esto fue debido a que sus hermanos la apoyaron para que ella tuviera de donde obtener ingresos, ya que los trabajos están escasos. El crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de ropa usada, ya que con este dinero le da solamente para comprar una paca de ropa seleccionada. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, de tal forma que pueda dejar de laborar, dedicarse a él enteramente y brindar estabilidad económica a su hijo pequeño. Desea por sobre todas las cosas brindar una educación superior a su hijo y que pueda ir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Josefa del Socorro M. Jiménez, 29, is a single mother with a one year old child. Josefa sells used clothes in her home. She also sells as a traveling saleswoman to people nearby. It is important to mention that she has been in this business for five years. She started the business selling a small quantity of merchandise because she did not have enough customers. Her siblings helped her so that she could have a way to get some income. Work is scarce. The loan is primarily to buy used clothes. The money is only to buy a pack of select clothing. Her dream is to improve her business in such a way that she can stop working and spend her time completely on her business. She would also like to bring economic stability to her small child. Above all else she would like to give her child a college education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S., 50 ans, mariée, est mère de 7 enfants et membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle y a contracté 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficultés. Elle fait un commerce de "nérétoué" (un produit alimentaire local) Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle participe activement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama S., aged 50, is married and is the mother of seven children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for seven years and obtained from it fourteen loans, which she always repaid without a problem. She does commerce in nérétoué (a local food product). With the profits she makes, she actively helps to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her small-scale business

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
El señor Fausto H. es propietario de su negocio de pulpería ubicado en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde ofrece todo tipo de productos como lo son granos básicos los que guarda en sacos, queso, crema, mantequilla y también vende detergentes, jabones, cloro, entre otros. 

El señor Fausto ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de estos productos y de esta manera mejorar su actividad y continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar y así beneficiar a sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mr. Fausto H. owns a general store in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua where he sells all kinds of products like basic grains, cheese, butter, detergent, soap, bleach, and other products. Fausto applied for the loan to purchase these products and in this way improve his business. This will allow him to continue to provide for his home and benefit his two school-age sons.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of procudts for his store

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora Maria Cristina S. Jiménez tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos todos menores de edad a su cargo. Dos de sus hijos están en escuelas de primaria, mientras su esposo labora como conductor de un microbús. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de queso y frutas, el cual está ubicado contiguo al mercado. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a la venta de queso, sin embargo fue hasta hace dos años que la señora decidió invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para vender en su tramo, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Ella lo empezó con un primo de su actual esposo, el cual también invirtió capital en la apertura del mismo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mas mercadería que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera su ganancia. Últimamente han tenido muchos problemas relacionados con la inestabilidad en el precio del producto, y es por ello que necesitan financiamiento para cubrir cualquiera de estos problemas. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Cristina S. Jiménez is 39 years old, is married, and has three young children. Two of her children are in primary school, and her husband works as a microbus driver. Maria has a business located next to the market where she sells cheese and fruits. She has sold cheese for more than 8 years, but it was not until 2 years ago that she decided to invest in the purchase of fruit and vegetables to sell in her space. She did this hoping to increase her income. She started this business with her husband's cousin, who invested capital. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more produce which will allow her to increase sales and thus her profits. Lately they have had problems because of the price instability of the products, and the financing will help handle those problems. Her dream has always been to grow her business in order to offer a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of produce and dairy products

loans.name: Saly Seydou

texts.fr: Saly Seydou S., 51 ans, mariée, avec 5 enfants en charge dont 2 qui vont à l'école est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle rembourse toujours sans difficulté. Elle développe une activité de vente de "nététou" (produit alimentaire locale)et des balais artisanaux. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille, telle que la dépense quotidienne, la santé des enfants et leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Saly Seydou S. is 51 years old, married and has 5 children, 2 of which attend school. She has been a member for 7 years of Banc Villageois (or "Village Bank") of TENGHORY DIAMALAYE. She has been the beneficiary of 14 loans which she repayed without difficulty. She is developing a business selling "nététou" ( a type of grain and a local food product) and artisanal brushes. She is an important caretaker of her family taking responsability for daily money matters as well as her childrens' health and their schooling.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her small business selling local food products and artisanal brushes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia es cliente antigua, ella anteriormente trabajo con el Banco de Emprendimiento Inti Wara;la actividad economica que realiza es la atencion diaria de la tienda de barrio que esta ubicada en su domicilio en la cual expende viveres, conservas, golosinas, lacteos y otros. Ella cuenta con vivienda propia la cual habita con su hijo y su esposo, cuyo trabajo esta relacionado con movimientos sociales. La señora Alicia utilizara el dinero del prestamo en amurallar su vivienda ademas de la compra de puerta de garaje que sera parte de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia is an old client; she previously worked for the Inti Wara Bank. The business that she runs every day is the neighborhood store which is located in her home where she sells perishable and non-perishable food items, snacks, dairy products, and other products. She has her own home where she lives with her son and her husband, who works supporting social movements. Mrs. Alicia will use the money from the loan to build a wall around her house/store and buy a garage door for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a wall for home/store

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora T. tiene 61 años de edad. La señora Maria tiene una venta de productos varios, tales como ropa, calzado, electrodomésticos y otras cosas, este negocio está ubicado en el mercado. Hace 45 años que se dedica a esta actividad, cabe señalarse que este negocio empezó de forma ambulante, luego logro establecerse en un tramo pequeño en el mercado y fue allí que sus ventas se incrementaron y logro reinvertir de manera eficiente para poder tener el negocio que posee en nuestros días. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que se está acercando la época navideña que es cuando se incrementan grandemente la venta de sus artículos. Maria sueña con llegar a tener una tienda grande y una venta de electrodomésticos bastante amplia que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora T. is 61 years old. Mrs. Maria runs a business selling various products like clothing, shoes, applicances, and other things. Her business is located in the market. She has worked in this business for 45 years. She began the business selling door to door and later was able to establish herself with a small booth in the market. There she was able to increase her sales and reinvest in an efficient manner and build the business that she has today. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise because Christmas season is coming and this is when her sales go up greatly. Maria dreams of owning a large store where she can sell enough appliances to offer economic stability for her relatives.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (clothing, appliances)

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is a 51-year-old Russian dancer who moved to the United States in 1991 and had a son soon after. After years struggling as a single mother and recent immigrant, she turned to her 20-plus years of dance experience for economic stability. “The first expression that I learned to say in English was ‘there are not too many things that I’m good at, but I can dance and I can teach people how to dance.’ ” In 2007, Svetlana opened her own business, “Stars in the Light”, as a dance studio without a home. She would travel to childcare facilities with her dance equipment: leotards, ballet bars, and a music player. Having successfully built up her clientele and firmly established herself as a sought-after dance instructor over the course of two years, Svetlana began renting space in a dance studio in 2009. She runs “Stars in the Light” as a non-profit dance education center, recalling the pivotal role dance played in her childhood and the government scholarship she received as a young girl to learn ballet. “I teach dance to all children who want to learn, no matter what price their parents can pay.” Along with a strong social mission, Svetlana has also managed to launch a financially sound business: she now employs two dance instructors and her business income continues to rise. She needs a $5,000 loan to pay for for her dance studio setup and equipment. Her “American” son, now a teenager, has been her biggest support, and took the photo of her above. Visit: www.starsinthelight.com.

loans.use: To pay for dance studio setup and equipment

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Our client is Clemencia.  She is part of a comunal bank consisting of 11 neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxiliadora, named after a virgin of Peru.  She is a native of Cusco.

She is 39 years old.  She lives together with her partner and has 2 children.  She is a conductor in one of the collective buses in Cusco. She will use this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

Clemencia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Transportation business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is Esther. She is 46 years-old, separated from her husband and has four children. Esther is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. Esther is a native of the district of Quiguijara, in the province of Quispicanchi and she currently lives in Cusco province.

Esther works out of her home selling groceries and beer. With the loan, she will buy more products to sell.

Esther appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Alix

texts.en:
Alix started buying used items and reselling them online as an after-school job in high school. Over time, she learned a lot about the fashion industry and founded “Apocalypse Vintage” in Portland, Oregon, two years ago. She began selling vintage clothing online and to local thrift stores and eventually employed a staff of seven people. For Alix, her company and vintage clothing represent a way for people to express their unique style and have a positive body image.

When the economy slowed down last year, Alix made the decision to downsize and move her business down to San Francisco, to take advantage of the more vibrant fashion industry in the Bay Area. With a $10,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, she recently signed a lease for a 9,000 square foot warehouse that will not only house her clothing inventory but also have space for fashion shows and photo shoots.

In the future, Alix hopes to sub-lease warehouse space out to other artists and develop a print production company. Asked where her business would be without Opportunity Fund, Alix is honest “I don’t know, but I think I would have had to grow much slower and put my dreams on hold.”

Visit:  apocalypsevintage.com.

loans.use: To lease showroom space

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
This is Ernestina. She is 45 years-old and single with two children. Ernestina is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. Ernestina is a native of Cusco.

Ernestina is a craftsperson and artist. From her home studio, she paints and makes lamps out of iron. With the loan, she will buy materials to continue her artistic endeavors.

Ernestina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for painting and lamp making.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Our client is Roxana.  She is part of a comunal bank consisting 11 neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after a virgin of Peru.  She is a native of Cusco.

She is 36 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She sells beauty products and clothing. With the loan, she will buy more products and clothing to sell.

Roxana appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: beauty products and clothing

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”, son 11 miembros que forman parte de este simpático grupo; nuestros miembros viven en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, situado a 45 minutos en auto desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con la agricultura como actividad principal, la ganadería y finalmente el comercio minorista, nuestras socias en su mayoría venden comida en el mercado central del pueblo, otras crían animales menores (cuyes, aves de corral, chanchos), para su futura venta, otras socias tiene sus tiendas de abarrotes y venta de CDs de música y de películas; nuestros socios incrementan poco a poco sus negocios haciéndolos más prósperos y más amplios, ellos se reinventan cada cierto tiempo para así ser más competitivos frente a otros negocios, solicitan el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido y así mismo prometen seguir adelante pese a las dificultades.
texts.en:
Eleven members make up this friendly group known as the "LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS" communal bank. The members live in the Andahuaylillas district which is 45 minutes by car from the city of Cusco. The members alternate their different activities with their main activities which are agriculture, livestock farming and retail sales. The women in the group, for the most part, sell prepared meals in the town's central market. Some of them raise small farm animals (guinea pigs, baryard fowl, pigs) for sale. Still others have grocery stores or sell music CDs or movies. Our members little by little increase their sales making their enterprises more prosperous and of wider variety. Every so often they reinvent themselves to be more competitive with other merchants. They request this loan to invest in their various business enterprises. Our members are grateful for and greatly value the funds obtained through this method and commit to the total repayment of their debt in the time frame agreed upon and pledge to continue forward despite difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the various enterprises.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca. She is 49 years-old and married with five children. Francisca is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. Francisca is a native of Cusco.

Francisca sells consumables such as ice cream, eggs, etc. in one of the large plazas in Cusco. With the loan, she will be able to stock more goods to sell.

Franciso appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a food stall.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Our client is Rosa.  She is part of a comunal bank consisting 11 neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxiliadora, named after a virgin of Peru.  She is a native of Quillabamba.

She is 41 years old.  She lives with her partner and her 3 children.  She sells dry goods in the market in one of the main plazas in Cusco.  With the loan, she will buy more products to sell.

Rosa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her stall

loans.name: Karina Selene

texts.en:
This is Karina Selene. She is 31 years-old and lives with her partner and their two children. Karina is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. Karina is a native of Cusco.

Karina sells beauty products. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products to sell.

Karina Selene appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia Paulina

texts.en:
Our client is Yesenia. She is 19 years-old and unmarried. Yesenia is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. She is a native of San Sebastian, Cusco.

Yesenia has been selling the Oriflame line of beauty products for the last three years. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products to sell.

Yesenia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Our client is Graciela.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of 11 neighbors in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the religious icon of Peru.  She is a native of Rondoca, in the Acomayo province.

Gracielais 35 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her 4 children. She has been raising small farm animals and growing vegetables to sell for the last 2 years.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her small farm.

Graciela appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in her farm

loans.name: Sayda

texts.en:
Our client is Sayda.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after a virgin saint of Peru.  She is a native of Kosñipata.

Sayda is 27 years old.  She lives with her partner and child.  She has completed secondary school.  She works as a “preventista,” which means she ensures that stores have the products they need to sell. In this case, she sells gas canisters.  Her business is located in the Industrial Park of Cusco.  With the loan, she will continue to work as a “preventista”, selling gas canisters to stores.

Sayda appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Augment her business of selling and refilling gas canisters

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia es una mujer colabora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 46 años, es madre D. seis hijos D. los cuales cinco son mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, también venD. turrones (dulce), al por mayor,  cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo para realizar las diferentes actividades que desarrolla. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desD. hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en perfumes, en la actualidad Adilia necesita un crédito D. 1700 soles que le permitirá invertir una parte en productos D. belleza y otra parte en prendas D. vestir para luego vender a sus clientes. La meta D. Adilia es tener una boutique y seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adilia is a persevering and cooperative woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 46 years old and has six children, five of whom are now adults. She sells beauty products by catalogue as well as wholesale candy. She has her husband's support in developing her various activities. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Valientes" Communal Bank for the past six years. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to purchase perfumes. She currently needs a loan of 1700 soles which she will use partly to buy beauty products and partly to buy clothing to resell to her customers. Her goal is to have a boutique and to continue working to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es una socia dinámica y muy colaboradora, vive en el caserío Señor de los milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el kilometro 21 carretera de Torna vista en el distrito de Campo verde, región de Ucayali, tiene 21 años, madre de un niño, Carolina se dedica a la siembra de arroz, frejol y yuca actividad que lo realiza junto a con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles que utilizó para comprar gallinas criarlas para luego venderlas, en la actualidad Carolina necesita en crédito de 1200 que será utilizado para comprar alimento balanceado para sus gallinas que luego serán vendidas en el mercado de esta localidad. La meta de Camila es tener una bodega bien surtido de productos y seguir apoyando a su esposo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carolina is a dynamic and cooperative member. She lives in the Señor de los Milagros hamlet which is located approximately at the 21 km marker on the Torna highway in the Campo Verde district, Ucayali region. She is 21 years old and the mother of one son. She, together with her husband, farms rice, beans and yucca. She has been a member of the "Mi Señor de los Milagros" communal bank for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 soles which she used to buy chickens to raise and sell. She currently needs a 1200 sol loan to buy feed for her chickens which will later be sold at the market in this locale. Her goal is to have a well-stocked store and to continue to help her husband to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Teresita De Jesús

texts.es: Teresita D. Jesús es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años y es madre D. ocho hijos, D. los cuales siete son mayores D. edad, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes que funciona en su casa y en la tarD. se dedica a la venta D. comidas como juanes (arroz envuelto en hojas), pescado ahumado, tacacho(plátano aplastado), ella venD. en la esquina D. su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso” desD. hace un año, el primer que obtuvo fue D. 500 soles que utilizó en la compra D. algunos artículos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado una parte para comprar productos para su bodega y otra parte invertirá en la compra D. manteles, sillas y cubiertos que utilizará en la venta D. comida. La meta D. Teresita es tener un restaurante D. platos típicos D. esta región.
texts.en:
Teresita D. Jesús is a dynamic, hard-working, 58 year old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of 8 children, 7 of whom are now adults. She has a small grocery store that she operates from her home and in the afternoons she sells prepared meals like juanes (rice wrapped in leaves), smoked fish, tacacho (smashed plantain) on the streetcorner by her house. She has been part of the "Mujeres al Progreso" communal bank for the past year. Her first 500 soles loan was to buy stock for her store. She now needs 1000 soles which will be used partly to buy inventory for the store and partly to invest in the purchase of tablecloths, chairs and place settings that she will use for her meal sales. Teresita's goal is to have a restaurant specializing in the typical dishes of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her store as well as tablecloths, chairs, and place settings.

loans.name: Basilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Basilia L. muy esforzadamente se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras ofreciendo tomates, chiltomas, zanahorias, cebollas, entre otros productos.

Ella a diario comercializa estos productos para obtener ingresos y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para recibir su crédito y así invertir en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión por medio de las verduras.
texts.en:
Basilia Lopez very diligently sells vegetables at the Managua Wholesale Market specializing, among others, in tomatoes, peppers, carrots and onions. She attends to her sales daily in order to produce income to meet her family's living expenses. She hopes to receive from Ceprodel funds to invest in inventory so that she can invest in her business through the sale of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara es una socia dinámica y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 41 años de edad, madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos son mayores, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, esta actividad lo realiza todos los días, ella vende en la vereda de su casa desde temprana horas de las mañanas hasta el medio día, ella es madre soltera y siempre a trabajado para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso” desde hace cinco años,  el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó para comprar gaseosa  para vender, en la actualidad Clara necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra  de productos para implementar la venta de menús. La meta de Clara es tener un restaurante para vender platos regionales.
texts.en:
Clara is a dynamic and very collaborative member who lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is 41 years old, and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are grown up. She dedicates herself to selling meals. She does this every day on the path by her house, from early morning until noon. She is a single mother and has always worked to get ahead.

Clara has been a part of the “Women for Progress” Communal Bank for 5 years. The first loan she received was for 300 sols which she used to buy soda water to sell. At present, Clara needs to borrow 1000 sols to buy products to facilitate the sale of items on her menu.

Clara's goal is to have a restaurant and sell regional dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS AND SUPPLIES FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Loidi

texts.es: Loidi es una socia emprendedora y activa, vive en el caserío de Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el kilómetro 21 carretera de Torna vista en el distrito de Campo Verde región de Ucayali, tiene 33 años, madre de tres hijos menores de edad, se dedica  a la siembra de yuca, plátano, frutas y arroz, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en esta actividad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace una año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de cerdos para criar y posteriormente venderlos en el mercado de su localidad, en la actualidad Loidi necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado en la compra de pollos y alimentos balanceados para los mismos para luego venderlos. La meta de Loidi es tener un restaurante de platos típicos de la región y seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Loidi is an enterprising and active member. She lives in the village of Señor de los Milagros, which is located at km 21 of the Torna Highway in the District of Campo Verde, Ucayali region. She is 33 years old and the mother of 3 dependent children. She and her husband grow cassava, banana, fruits, and rice.

She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Mi Señor de los Milagros” (My Lord of Miracles) for one year. The first loan she received was for 300 soles and was used to purchase pigs for breeding, which were later sold at the local market. Loidi currently needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy chickens and poultry feed so that she can sell the birds later. Her goal is to open a restaurant where she sells traditional regional dishes so that she can continue to move forward in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens & poultry feed

loans.name: Segunda Clorinda

texts.es:
La señora SEGUNDA CLORINDA C. A., tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 2DO de Primaria, refiere que dejo de estudiar porque sus padres la llevan al campo a que los ayude.. Se caso la edad de 17 años y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales el ultimo de 17 años de edad depende económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de pan. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro sacos de harinas la por mayor, manteca ,sal, levadura para la preparación de su pan.
Con este crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de harina, levadura ,manteca, sal y también leña al por mayor para vender. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener dinero y seguir apoyando a que su hijo termine su carrera.
texts.en:
Sra. Segunda Clorinda C. A. is 55 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the San Luis Communal Bank and has a 2nd grade education. Segunda says she left school because her parents wanted her to help them in the fields. She got married at age 17 and now has 4 children. The youngest child is 17 years old and still financially dependent because he is a student.

Segunda prepares and sells bread. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy sacks of flour at wholesale, shortening, salt, and yeast in order to bake bread.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase sacks of flour, yeast, shortening, and salt. She also will buy firewood in bulk for resale. Segunda dreams of increasing her sales so that she earn an income and continue supporting her son’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for baking bread & firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Ester Violeta

texts.es:
La señora ESTER VIOLETA G. P. , tiene 57 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 1ero de Primaria, refiere que en su época los padres no se preocupaban por darle estudios a sus hijos sino porque aprendan a trabajar .
Por ese motivo ella dejó de estudiar y desde niña empezó a trabajar cuidando niños y en los que haceres domésticos. Se caso la edad de 17 años y tiene 12 hijos ,todos casados e independientes.
Violeta se dedica compra y venta de leña. Así como también a la venta de azúcar y arroz. Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro leña al por mayor para luego viajar a Trujillo a venderla en los mercados mayoristas.
Con este crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará leña al por mayor y sacos de azúcar y arroz. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas y poder ahorrar algo de dinero para afrontar el invierno que es la temporada en donde bajan las ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ester Violeta Guzmán P. is 57 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the San Luis Communal Bank and has a 1st grade education. Violeta says her parents were not concerned about providing their children an education because it was more important for them to learn how to work. For this reason, she quit school so that she could start taking care of her siblings and help with the household chores. She got married at age 17 and now has 12 children who are all married and independent.

Violeta buys and sells firewood. She also sells sugar and rice. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased firewood in bulk and sold it at the wholesale markets in Trujillo.

With her current loan of 2000 soles, Violeta will buy firewood in bulk and sacks of sugar and rice. She hopes to generate more business so that she can save for the winter season when sales are lower.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood in bulk & sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 62 años D. edad, madre D. dos hijos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, pues tiene una tienda que funciona en su casa, Florinda trabaja junto con su esposo en este negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal ”Mujeres  Trabajadoras” desD. hace cinco años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, que lo utilizó en la compra D. golosinas. En la actualidad Florinda necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar una parte golosinas y otra para comprar cajas D. gaseosas para vender. La meta D. Florinda es surtir su negocio y salir adelante con su esposo.
texts.en:
Florinda is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 62 years old and the mother of two adult children. She sells groceries from a store that she operates out of her home. She works alongsiD. her husband. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" communal bank for the past five years. The first 300 soles loan she got was used to purchase snacks. Florinda currently needs a 1000 sol loan a part of which she will use to purchase snacks and the other to buy soft drinks by the case to sell. Florinda's goal is to stock her store and, together with her husband, get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nelith

texts.es: Nelith es una mujer colaboradora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 39 años y es madre de un adolescente, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso” desde hace 10 meses, el primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que  utilizó para invertir en granos, como maíz, frejol de la región, para vender en los diferentes mercados de la localidad, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de abarrotes y bebidas para  vender en su bodega. La meta de Nelith es ampliar su bodega y progresar.
texts.en:
Nelith is a cooperative and cheerful woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and the mother of a teen-ager. She sells groceries from a store that she operates out of her home. Her husband encourages her work and he works selling lumber. She has been a member of the "Mujeres al Progreso" communal bank for the last 10 months. Her first 300 sol loan was used to invest in grains such as corn, and beans to sell in the various local markets. Now she needs a 1500 sol loan to purchase groceries and beverages for her store. Nelith's goal is to enlarge her store and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma es una socia dinámica y  trabajadora , vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años, madre D. tres hijos mayores D. edad, Norma se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, pues tiene una tienda que funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en artículos para su bodega, ahora Norma necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado para la compra D. prendas D. vestir para vender posteriormente en diferentes lugares. La meta D. Norma es tener una fuente D. soda y seguir superándose económicamente.
texts.en:
Norma is a dynamic and hard-working member who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 49 years old and the mother of three adult children. She sells groceries from a store she operates from her home. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" communal bank for the past 8 years. Her first, 300 sol loan allowed her to purchase articles to sell in her store. Now, Norma needs a 1000 sol loan to purchase items of clothing which she intends to sell in various locations. Norma's goal is to have a soda fountain and to continue to improve financially.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 41 años y vive con Cinthya, su pareja, con la que tiene 2 hermosos hijos; Rani de 5 y Amisha de 3 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia en el distrito de Ventanilla, al norte de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 7 años él se dedica a la electromecánica, es decir está capacitado para refaccionar diferentes aparatos, pero actualmente viene trabajando frecuentemente con vehículos. A Eduardo su trabajo le apasiona y siempre lo realiza con gran gusto, pero como él dice “No es nada fácil”, pues requiere de gran precisión y mucho esfuerzo. Felizmente lo realiza con vocación y eso provoca que sus clientes siempre se vayan muy contentos de su taller, con lo cual obtiene buenas ganancias. Para el futuro espera tener otro negocio que le sea igual de provechoso, él ha pensado poner una ferretería para así tener un negocio familiar.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos repuestos que le hacen falta para el acabado de los vehículos que le dejaron a reparar.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 41 years old. He lives with his partner, Cinthya, with whom he has two beautiful children: Rani, 5 and Amisha, 3. They live in their own home in the Ventanilla district, north of Lima. For the past 7 years he has repaired electric appliances although recently he has been working on vehicles. Eduardo is passionate about his work and always carries it out with great pleasure but, as he says, 'It's not at all easy" since it requires a great deal of precision and effort. Happily, he does it with dedication and that causes his customers to leave his shop happy which, in turn, leaves him with good profits. For the future he would like to have another, equally profitable business; he has thought of opening a hardware store so as to have a family business. This is his third loan with MFP and he has always been very punctual with his repayments. With these funds he will purchase some replacement parts that he needs for some of the vehicles that have been left for him to repair.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer colaboradora y activa, vive en el caserío de Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el kilómetro 21 carretera de Torna vista en el distrito de Campo Verde región de Ucayali, tiene 54 años, madre de once hijos de los cuales ocho son mayores de edad, Margarita se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pues tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles que le permitió invertir en productos para su tienda, en la actualidad Margarita necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en implementar su negocio comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc. La meta de Margarita es tener una tienda grande y bien surtida.
texts.en:
Margarita is a cooperative and active woman who lives in the Señor de los Milagros hamlet which is located at the 21km marker on the Torna highway in the Campo Verde district, Ucayali region. She is 54 years old and the mother of 11 children, 8 of whom are adults. Margarita sells groceries from a little store she operates from her home. Her husband is a farmer and he supports her efforts. She has been a member of the “Mi Señor de los Milagros” communal bank for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 soles and she used it to invest in items for her store. Margarita currently needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. to stock her store. Margarita's goal is to have a well-stocked, large store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory items such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 62 años muy trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar con su esposo (Rosendo), de 65 años, y también la acompañan sus hijos mayores: Grermer de 29 y Edilson de 21 años.

Ella se dedica, junto a su esposo, al alquiler de mesas de billar en la amplia sala de su casa. Para lograrlo sacó sus muebles e instaló este singular negocio, el cual tiene mucha acogida, sobre todo los fines de semana. Entre sus asiduos clientes se encuentran vecinos y amigos, quienes visitan su salón de billar para distraerse. 

Para el futuro, Gloria piensa comprar más mesas de billar y hacer crecer su negocio, ya que no tiene mucha competencia. Adicionalmente, esta trabajadora mujer, también se dedica a la costura durante las tardes y confecciona lindas prensas de vestir. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque conoce a todas las integrantes desde hace mucho tiempo. Además el dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en herramientas de costura y en su negocio de juegos (billar).
texts.en:
Gloria is a 62 year old woman who is very hard-working and dynamic. She lives in the tranquility of her home with her husband (Rosendo) who is 65. Her grown children, 29 year old Grermer and 21 year old Edilson, live with them. She and her husband rent pool tables in the large living room of their house. To do this she took out the furniture and set up this unique business. It is very well received, especially on the week-ends. Her regular customers are her neighbors and friends. They visit her pool room to entertain themselves. In the future, Gloria is thinking of buying more pool tables to make her business grow. She does not have much competition. Additionally, this hard-working woman sews during the afternoons, and she makes lovely dresses. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She is in agreement with the work the communal bank does because she has known all of the members for a long time. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy tools for sewing and for her pool business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for sewing

loans.name: Indalecia

texts.es:
Indalecia es una ama de casa de 61 años, vive sólo con su esposo (Leonardo) de 65 años porque todos sus hijos ya formaron sus propias familias. A pesar de su edad esta señora es muy activa y emprendedora. Desde hace medio año se levanta muy temprano para preparar deliciosos jugos y extractos de fruta fresca y clasificada, los que posteriormente reparte a sus habituales clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos.
