Para ella es muy importante ofrecer un buen producto a sus clientes a un precio justo, ya que ella es un a mujer honesta y le gusta hacer las cosas siempre correctas. Además, considera que este negocio le genera buenas ganancias porque se esmera en preparar los jugos para que sean lo preferidos de la clientela. 

Indalecia es una mujer muy trabajadora y esta cualidad la heredó a sus hijos. Hace algunos años tuvo una juguería en su casa, pero la tuvo que cerrar por motivos personales, pero sueña con poder reaperturarla algún día, ya que tiene casi todos los implementos, lo único que le falta es capital, pero le sobran ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y asegura que cumplirá con sus pagos y será muy responsable. Entre sus proyectos inmediatos, y para lo que solicita esta cantidad de dinero, es adquirir extractores modernos, además de productos naturales dietéticos para añadirlos en los desayunos que ofrecerá en su juguería. En el futuro para mantenerse sano se deberá consumir en la jugueria de Indalecia, comenta sonriente.
texts.en:
Indalecia is a 61-year-old housewife who lives just with her 65-year-old husband (Leonardo) because all of her children have left home to form their own families. Despite her age, this is a very active and enterprising woman. For the past 6 months she has risen early to prepare delicious fruit juices and fresh fruit extracts which she then distributes among her regular customers who, for the most part, are her neighbors. For her, it is crucial to be able to offer a good product at a fair price since she is an honest woman who likes to do things always in the correct manner. Besides, she believes this is a profitable business because she takes great pains to prepare juices that are her customers' favorites. Indalecia is a very hard working woman and she instilled this value into her children. A few years ago she operated a toy store in her home but had to close due to personal reasons. However, she dreams with being able to reopen it some day since she still owns almost all the equipment; her only lack is capital. But, she has no shortage of will to work and get ahead. This is her first loan with MFP and she assures us that she will be responsible with her repayment. Among her immediate projects, and the reason she needs these funds, is to purchase modern juice extractors as well as natural dietary products to add to her breakfasts which she will offer in her toy store. She smilingly states: in future, to stay healthy, one must eat in Indalecia's toy store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase juicers.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre emprendedor de 33 años, vive con su pareja (Sofía), de también 33 años, con quien tiene 3 preciosos hijos que son su orgullo e inspiración; Hans de 10 años, Harol de 3 y Gianela de 2 años.
Desde hace 12 años, él se dedica a la venta de peculiares alcancías con formas animadas de intensos colores. En cada lugar que las vende éstas no pasan desapercibidas por la vivacidad de cada una. Jhon compra las alcancías al por mayor y las vende por unidad en el lugar donde vive y también las lleva a vender a diferentes ciudades del Perú, donde tienen bastante acogida. 

Jhon está contento con su negocio porque la venta de alcancías tiene demanda durante cualquier época del año y porque a cada lugar donde va la gente le dice que son muy hermosas y se animan a comprarlas. Además, para la época de navidad también vende adornos navideños. Para el futuro piensa aperturar una tienda de alcancías y venderlas al por mayor.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos porque tiene muchos sueños que cumplir y además sabe que siendo responsable logrará hacerlos realidad.

Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería y así venderá más alcancías, cuyos colores alegran la vista.
texts.en:
Jhon is an enterprising, 33-year-old, man who lives with his partner (Sofia), also 33, with whom he has three lovely children who are his pride and inspiration: Hans, 10, Harol, 3, and Gianela, 2. For the past 12 years he has sold unique, animated, intensely colored, piggy banks. Wherever he goes to sell them they immediately draw interest because folks say they are very beautiful and vivacious and they are, therefore, motivateded to purchase them. In addition, during the Christmas season he sells holiday decorations. In the future, he would like to open a store in which to sell his banks at wholesale. This is his third loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he has many dreams to fulfill and knows that by being responsible he can make them come true. With these funds he intends to purchase more stock and thereby sell more banks whose colors are a pleasure to behold.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es una trabajadora mujer de 60 años de edad, desde la muerte de su esposo vive con sus 4 hijos: Richard de 40, Carlos de 38, Revelino de 30  y Aníbal de 22. Desde hace 22 años se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto en uno de los mercados de su localidad, donde prepara diversidad de platillos para sus clientes, los cuales siempre se van muy contentos, ya que Maximiliana se esmera mucho en la atención y en brindarles todo lo necesario para que puedan disfrutar los ricos platillos que cocina. 

Por lo general dedica gran parte del día al preparado de las comida, ya que le gusta mucho cocinar, siendo ésta una de sus principales habilidades. Además, sus hijos son mayores, trabajan y no puede pasar todo el tiempo que quisiera con ellos, por ello que se dedica a su trabajo. A consecuencia ha hecho muchas amigas, ya que ya tiene muchas “caseritas” (clientes frecuentes), las cuales siempre consumen sus platillos. 

Maximiliana tiene muchas esperanzas de salir adelante y de hacer prosperar su negocio, es por ello que solicita este crédito para mejorarlo y hacerlo crecer.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos, ya que sabe que la responsabilidad es la base del éxito. Con este dinero comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para poder preparar más porciones y así ganar mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a hard-working, 60-year-old, woman who, since her husband's death, lives with her 4 sons: Richard, 40, Carlos, 38, Revelino, 30 and Anibal, 22. For the past 22 years she has sold prepared meals in a stand in one of the markets in her town where she offers her customers a variety of dishes which always causes her customers to leave happy and satisfied since Maximiliana works very hard to provide everything they need to enjoy the delicious meals she prepares. Generally, she devotes most of the day to meal preparation since she loves to cook and this is one of her main skills. Besides, her sons are all adults and work and she cannot spend as much time with them as she would like so she spends time working. As a result, she has made many new friends since she has many regular customers ("caseritas") who always consume her meals. Maximiliana has great hope to get ahead in life and to see her business grow for which she requests this loan to improve it and make it grow. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with her repayments since she knows that responsibility is the basis for success. With these funds she will buy raw materials in greater quantity to prepare more servings and attract a larger number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for meal preparation.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una mujer muy laboriosa y a sus 56 años no para D. trabajar todo el día. Vive con su esposo Amílcar, quien tiene 60 años y con su hijo Giancarlo D. 17 años. Su casa es pequeña, pero muy acogedora y está ubicada en un populoso distrito al norte D. la ciudad D. Lima.

Ella se despierta cada día al amanecer y abre la tienda D. abarrotes que tiene en su casa, así lo hace desD. hace un año atrás, tiempo en el que se animó a poner este negocio, ya que en la zona por donD. vive no hay mucha competencia. 
Durante las tardes le deja el cuidado D. la tienda a su hijo y se va a trabajar a un mercado cercano donD. tiene un puesto D. especerías (condimentos) que ella misma prepara en su hogar. Sofía no se cansa D. trabajar porque quiere salir adelante, y al caer la noche regresa a su casa para seguir atendiendo su tienda. Así transcurren sus días y lo hace con gusto, porque quiere darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia y porque tiene ganas D. salir adelante. 
En el futuro Sofía piensa en granD. y quiere ampliar su negocio con varias exhibidores D. productos y mayor cantidad D. mercancía.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y como siempre promete ser cumplida, porque ella sabe que solo así se sale adelante en la vida. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina exhibidora moderna para lograr captar la atención D. los clientes y también surtirá mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sofia is a very hard-working, 56-year-old woman who doesn't stop working all day. She lives with her 60-year-old husband, Amilcar, and her 17 year-old son, Giancarlo. Her house is small but very welcoming and it is located in a crowded district north of Lima. She rises at daybreak each day to open her grocery store that she has operated from her home for the past year, which was the time when she became motivated to establish this business since there isn't much competition in the area where she lives. During the afternoons she leaves her son in charge of the store and she goes to work at the local market where she tends a stand where she sells home-maD. spices and condiments that she prepares herself at home. Sofia is a tireless worker because she wants to get ahead and at nightfall she returns home to continue tending her store. Thus the days follow each other but Sofia faces them happily because she wants to proviD. a better quality of life for her family and because she wants to get ahead in life. In the future, Sofia is thinking big and would like to enlarge her store with several display stands and a greater quantity of merchandise. This is her sixth loan with MFP and, as usual, she commits to be punctual with her repayments since she realizes that this is how one gets ahead in life. With the funds she is requesting she intends to buy a modern display case to better capture the attention of prospective customers and she will also better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase display stands and increase stock.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora S. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 54 years old and married with two grown children. To make a living, Melchora owns and operates a business making and selling snacks like rice cakes, banana cue (fried and sugared or carmelized bananas) and other delicacies in the local community. Melchora has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Melchora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melchora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en:
Rustica D. R. is 57 years old and happily married to Rufino D. R., who is currently working as a driver in their town. They were blessed with three sons: Jefferson, age 33; Reynaldo, age 30; and Alvin, age 28. The two older sons attained only a high school education, but Alvin got a two-year course in college with the help of his brother, Reynaldo, who is now working as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker).

The main source of their family income is their rug-making business which they have been involved in for twelve years. The rugs are made by sewing together pieces of fabric remnants to create both small and big rugs. According to Rustica, this business gives them enough income for their expenses because they persevere in making rugs everyday.

Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) contributes a lot to why their business is now doing well. This institution helps them make their life much more comfortable than before. Now, requesting her fourth loan from ASHI, Rustica wants to use the loan to make their business grow more. If ever her business gives them more profit, she wants to save for the future of her family, especially her grandchildren. Rustica wants them to complete their studies through college. This is one of her life's dreams.

loans.use: To finance her rug-making business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Even at the young age of 28, Mary Grace E. is very eager to get her family out of the shadow of poverty. She is married to Reynante E., who works as a barber in their town. They have two children: Gracian Dave, who is in second grade and Geremy, now in first grade. They have more expenses than before because of their children's schooling, so Mary Grace wants to help her husband provide for their needs. She wants her children to go to college so they can have a better life in the future. When Mary Grace joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), in 2002, her business was already in operation. She sells a variety of beauty products, ready-to-wear clothes, shoes and a selection of bags. Recently she used a loan that she received from them to expand her business. Now, requesting her twelfth loan, Mary Grace will use the additional capital to improve her business by offering more things for sale so that she can gain more profit. Through the years this business has been a big help to their family. Her income, added to the income of her husband from being a barber, contributes to the family in many ways.

They have another business, which is raising different animals that they can sell, especially if there is some occasion. These profits also contribute to their daily expenses, so Mary Grace will use some amount of her loan to buy animals to raise, like chickens. Aside from her dream that her children finish their studies, Mary Grace also wants to save for the renovation of their house to a much more comfortable and sturdier one. Of course it is because she wants her family to experience a better life that she works so hard.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Encarnacion Remedios

texts.es: La señora Encarnación es una cliente antigua de la institución, se dedica a la compra y venta de electrodomésticos con 10 años de experiencia. La Sra. es Separada de su esposo, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, que le acompaña cuando va a visitar a sus clientes; vive en la casa de su papá, quien también le colabora en todo lo que puede. Es una cliente muy puntual y este crédito será invertido en completar el saldo que le hace falta para comprar una movilidad  a medio uso y así poder entregar sus pedidos en menos tiempo.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a long time client of the institution; she purchases and sells household appliances, and counts with 10 years of experience in this business. She is separated from her husband, and has one 15 year-old daughter that accompanies her when she visits her clients; she lives in her father’s house, who also helps in any way he can. She is a punctual client, and this loan will be used to complete the amount that she needs to purchase a used means of transportation so that she can deliver her orders in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete the amount that she needs to purchase a used means of transportation.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta owns and operates a general store and eatery business in their village.  With her desire to expand her store and make it more productive, she is now asking for financial support from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP12,000.  Sometimes she also does dress-making for an extra source of income.

With the income from her store, Julieta was able to send her children to school, and five of them have already graduated from college.  Her youngest is already a third-year nursing student.  One of her childen is disabled.  Julieta is hoping that the lenders will grant her loan request, for it is really a big help, not only in her business but also in her family.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a resident of Barangay Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Raul and they are blessed with three children: Raymart, 18; Ryan Paul, 13; and Richmoon, 7. The eldest is presently studying Information Technology in college; the second is studying in high school, while the youngest is in grade two. Esmeralda dreams that her children will all earn college degrees and become successful.  

Despite the hardships of life, Esemeralda and Raul help each other cultivate their rice field by planting rice and vegetables twice a year. Esmeralda is now requesting a loan of 28,000 PHP for the maintenance of their crops to ensure a good yield this coming harvest season. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will assist them in their farming needs.

loans.use: For the maintenance of their farm

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old and from the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Lacer who is 29 years old and works as a tricycle driver. They are blessed with three children, two are already studying and the youngest is one year old.  

Jennifer is a vendor in their village. In the morning she sells meat, fish, chicken and longganisa (a type of sausage).  In the afternoon, she sells different snacks like pansit, native cakes, ice candy, and bananas. She patiently retails her products from house to house to earn a living.  She can see that her business is growing and for it to become more productive she has requested a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP7,000.  She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Solange

texts.es:
El Sra. S. R. Solange es cliente antigua vive en El Torno aproximadamente 24 años y cuenta con su negocio propio hace dos años.
La cliente es propietaria de casa ella es casada, la cliente es oriunda de Guijarro tiene dos hijos un hombre y una mujer; a los cuales los hacen estudiar, el sueño de la pareja es verlos profesionales a sus dos hijos, por ello, ambos esposos mantienen el negocio. La actividad economica que realizan es la de venta de ropa de mujer, en ambientes de su propio domicilio; requieren el credito para comprar ropa para fin de año.
texts.en:
S. R. Solange is a long time client; she has lived in El Torno for approximately 24 years, and has run her own business for the past two years. The client is a homeowner, married, and a native of Guijarro. She has two children, a son and a daughter, and she makes sure that they both study. The couple’s dream is that their two children become professionals, and because of this, both she and her husband run the business. They sell women’s clothing from their house and require the loan to purchase clothing for the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase clothing).

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a widow with six children: Edgardo, a farmer; Evangeline, a full-time housewife; Egentor, a farmer; Edmund, a factory worker; Edison, a fisherman; and the youngest, Emma, a factory worker. She also has an adopted child. Narcisa wants to improve her family's standard of living and her motivation in life is to work hard to support her family's needs. The family live in San Pablo, Alicia, Isabela, a rural area. Their house is near an irrigation area and rice farm.

Narcisa has managed a livestock business for more than five years and her net monthly income from her hogs ranges from 2,500 to 5,000 PHP. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva lenders in order to have enough capital to purchase feed supplies. She also wants to have an additional pig pen for her hogs.

loans.use: To buy feed and an additional pig pen

loans.name: Beverlita

texts.en:
Beverlita R. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 53 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Beverlita owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Beverlita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Beverlita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles and thread. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles and thread

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia tiene su pension, ubicada en la zona de Villa Salome, tiene ya siete años de experiencia en este rubro, vive con su esposo que le ayuda en el negocio, y él tiene su salon de billar que está cambiando de zona,  tienen una hija pequeñita. Doña Vicky es una cliente muy responsable y su negocio fue creciendo poco a poco, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas, piensan abrir otra pension, ya que con este negocio les está yendo muy bien.
texts.en:
Virginia has a small restaurant located in the Villa Salome zone, and she already has seven years of experience in this field. She lives with her husband who helps her with the business, and he also owns a pool hall that he is currently moving from one area to another. They have a small daughter. Vicky is a very responsible client, and her business has been growing little by little. She will invest the loan in the purchase of tables and chairs, and they are planning on opening another small restaurant, given that this business is going very well.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek P. is 30 years old and resides in the Takeo province with her husband and two young children. Together with her husband, she makes and sells brooms at the local market to earn a living and they are able to make around $3.00 of profit every day. Ek P. is asking for a loan of $800, which she needs to purchase more materials so that she can make more brooms to sell.

loans.use: To buy materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen P. is a 45 year-old widow who has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province. She has three children who stay at home making brooms for her to sell. The brooms are made from a kind of long grass that grows in the forest. She earns approximately $4 each day.

Chen learned how to make brooms from her neighbors and started her business in 2004. She told to a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around $45 on food and $5 on utilities. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's local partner Credit to purchase the long grass in bulk. This will save money and allow her to increase the number of brooms she can make and sell.

loans.use: To buy materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 32 years old. She is married to Isidro and they are blessed with two children who are both in elementary education. Rosayln has a sari-sari store (community-based general store) business while her husband works as a village policeman. She dreams of business growth so that she can save something for her children's education.

To pursue her plans for her business, Rosalyn is now asking for additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to 12,000 PHP so that she can buy more grocery items for her store. In this way, she can offer more products to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El Sr.  Silverio es originario del departamento de Chuquisaca vive aproximadamente 25 años en la comunidad, trabaja sus tierras sembrando maíz y maní.
El cliente cuenta con 20 cabezas de ganado, trabajan toda la familia en sus tierras. Tienen cuatro hijos, todos ellos van al colegio, pero le colaboran en la actividad economica, ya que esta es la que los mantiene; sus productos los llevan al pueblo para poder venderlos, este se encuentra a 30 kilometros de distancia de su propiedad.  El crédito será utilizado para la compra de semillas para su sembradío y para la compra de forraje para su ganado.
texts.en:
Silverio is originally from the Chuquisaca department, and has lived in this community for approximately 25 years. He cultivates his lands, planting corn and peanuts. This client owns 20 heads of cattle, and the entire family works the lands. They have four children, all of which attend school but also help in the family business given that this is what financially supports them. They take their products to the town to sell them; the town is 30 kilometers from their property. This loan will be used to buy seeds for planting and to buy forage for his cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital.

loans.name: Emeliza

texts.en:
Emeliza is 35 years old and a resident of Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. She works as a hog raiser and also helps her husband, a blacksmith, in making knives. She usually sells their products in Tuguegarao City and, sometimes, in other towns. The couple help one another in generating a larger income for their family, especially to support their children's education.

Emeliza is hardworking and she patiently maintains their small enterprises in order to improve their currently poor standard of living. For this reason, she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP to be used as additional business capital. Emeliza is grateful that she can help her parents with their basic needs through her income. She is hoping that their business will become successful someday so that she can give her family a comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: As additional capital for her manufacturing business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto, de 38 años, es padre de un hijo de 4 añitos de edad y vive junto a su esposa quien lo apoya mucho. Desde hace 2 años cuenta en su casa con un pequeño negocio de venta de comida, donde brinda desayuno y almuerzo de lunes a viernes, mientras que los sábados y domingos prepara parrilladas y bebidas heladas, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es la encargada de estos preparativos, y es él quien atiende a los clientes

Adicionalmente, Augusto trabaja para una entidad privada dedicada a la erradicación de la hoja de coca, labor que viene efectuando desde hace 7 años. Lo que más le gusta de sus labores es que se relaciona con muchas personas y se entretiene, además le es muy rentable porque ambas cosas le producen buenos ingresos con los que mantiene tranquilamente a su familia.   

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que son personas trabajadoras y responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina (platos, tazas y cubiertos) para su negocio.
texts.en:
Augusto, 38 years old, is father of a four-year-old son and lives with his wife who is very supportive of him. For two years now, he has been running a small restaurant business out of his house, where he sells breakfast and lunch Monday through Friday, while on Saturdays and Sundays he makes barbecue and cold drinks. His wife is in charge of making the food and he is the one who serves the customers. Additionally, Augusto works for a private entity dedicated to the eradication of coca leaves, which he has been doing for seven years. What he likes most about his work is that he interacts with many people and has a good time. In addition, it is very profitable because both jobs produce good income which keeps his family comfortable. This is his first loan with MFP and what he likes about his group is that they are very hardworking and responsible people. With the money that he is now requesting he will buy tables, chairs, and kitchenware (plates, cups, and utensils) for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture for his business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita L. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Mercedita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita makes and sells food. The main source of income for this business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies. Mercedita has been running her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing raw ingredients

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 50 años, vive solo con su esposo, quien es pensionista, ya que sus hijos ya formaron sus propias familias y viven lejos D. ellos. DesD. hace 8 años tiene en su casa un ambiente adecuado donD. tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, productos comestibles D. primera necesidad, golosinas, bebidas y helados. Carmen atienD. durante todo el día y como su casa es bien amplia no dudo en instalar unas cabinas telefónicas, las cuales son D. mucha utilidad para ella y sus vecinos. 

Lo que le gusta a Carmen D. su negocio es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, mantenerse ocupada y sentirse útil ante la sociedad. Además, le es muy rentable porque su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona, ya tiene varios clientes regulares y sus ingresos son diarios. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy agradecido con su banco comunal porque le dieron la oportunidad D. trabajar con ellos, sobre todo porque tiene buenos comentarios D. esta metodología D. préstamos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá para incrementar los productos D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old and lives alone with her husband who is retired since their children have their families and live far away. Since 8 years ago, she has in her home a store where she sells groceries, basic household goods, candy, beverages and ice cream. Carmen takes care of the store all day and since her home is roomy she would like to have some telephone booths, which would be very useful for her and her neighbors.

What Carmen enjoys about her business is the attention that she gives to her customers, keeping busy and feeling useful in society. Besides, it is profitable because her business is located in a good place, and she has regular customers and her profits are daily.

This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner), for which she is very grateful to the communal bank because she has the opportunity to work with them, especially since she has heard the good comments of this method of acquiring loans. The money that she seeks will be invested to increase the products of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto B. Jr. is 28 years old. He is married to Babylyn, an overseas Filipino worker. The couple were blessed with two children: Vince, 5 years old and already in preschool, and Jackielyn, 3 years old. He is living with his son at San Pablo, Alicia Isabela, while his daughter is being cared for by his parents. Before his wife went abroad, she entrusted her business to Roberto Jr., which he has managed for almost three months.  

Additionally, Roberto works as a motorcycle driver. He has done this for almost two years and earns a daily income of PHP 300.00. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000.00 from the Kiva lenders that he needs for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.use: repairing and maintaining his motorcycle

loans.name: Deniz

texts.es:
Deniz tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de madera; tienen 2 hijos los mismos que están estudiando. Desde hace un año cuenta con un pequeño local frente a su casa donde vende ropa, zapatos y accesorios (carteras, correas, joyas, etc.) solo para damas. Asimismo, hace 15 tuvo la oportunidad de construir 4 departamentos en el mismo terreno donde vive, de los cuales obtiene buenos ingresos por su alquiler.

Lo que más le gusta a Deniz de su negocio de ropa y accesorios, es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, quienes son muy exigentes y detallistas y ella sabe cómo convencerlas para que le compren sus productos. 

Para el futuro a Deniz le gustaría tener una tienda de venta de ropa sólo para caballeros.
Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son responsables y se apoyan mutuamente en cualquier situación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa y accesorios para damas, y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Deniz is 41 years old, and lives with her partner who works purchasing and selling wood; they have 2 children that are both studying. For the past year she has run a small locale located in front of her house where she sells clothing, shoes, and accessories (purses, belts, jewelry, etc.) for women. Also, she was able to build 4 apartments on the same property where she lives, from which she obtains a good income by renting them out. What Deniz most enjoys about her business selling clothing and accessories is satisfying her clients’ needs; these clients are very demanding and meticulous, however, she knows how to encourage them so that they buy her products. In the future Deniz would like to own a men’s clothing store. She already has received 3 loans through MFP, and what she most enjoys about her Communal Bank is that all the members are responsible and support each other in any situation. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase more women’s clothing and accessories to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (women’s clothing and accessories).

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites runs a general store and raises hogs. She dreams that her business will become profitable; consequently, she is asking for the support of Kiva lenders for her businesses. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000, which she needs to purchase more commodities for her store and to maintain her hog raising business.

Marites is 36 years old. She is married to Roderick; they are living in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. They have six children, one of whom is at the high school level while the remaining five are at the elementary school level.

loans.use: improving her general store

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene is a village store owner. She sold snacks called pansit (noodles) by roaming around their village until she was able to put up this store. She can now offer more commodities to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for more business development; consequently, she is now asking for additional capital from Kiva lenders, amounting to PHP 7,000.  

Jene is married to Magno, who works as an all around laborer in their village. He is a good carpenter and is often hired in their village. They have three children, all of whom are studying. Jene hopes that her business will further expand so that she will be able to provide for her children, especially when it comes to their education.

loans.use: buying more goods

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.ru: Ятимов Давлатмурод проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Давлатмурод имеет среднее образование. Он более 6 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Этот вид бизнеса является второстепенным доход, т.к. он еще занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Davlatmurod Y. lives in the Yavan district. He is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. Davlatmurod has secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. raising and selling livestock, for over 6 years. This business provides him a secondary income because he is also involved in the taxi service. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Faizihon

texts.ru: Шодиев Файзихон проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Файзихон имеет среднее образование. Жена домохозяйка. Файзихон более 4 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает их на рынке в качестве мяса.
texts.en:
Faizihon S. lives in the Yavan district. He is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. Faizihon has secondary education. His wife is a homemaker. Faizihon has been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years; he raises and sells livestock at a market for meat consumption.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Djabor

texts.en:
A. Djabor is a 53 year old married man with 4 children. After finding it very difficult to get a job and needing to generate an income, he started his own small business selling groceries 5 years ago. Djabor began by selling a small selection of basic products and added to his inventory as he gained more customers. His business has expanded greatly thanks to his efforts and he was recently able to purchase a larger refrigerator. Djabor is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to purchase additional merchandise to stock his store and meet his customers' demand. Your support will help improve his life and expand his business. Thank you! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, moreover, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Unfortunately, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing more food to increase the range of items sold in his store

loans.name: Abdusator

texts.en:
A. Abdusator is a 55-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hardworking man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Abdusator has been running a business raising and selling sheep. He has 16 years of experience in this field. Since sheep raising and selling is a profitable business, Abdusator has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding them, and pasturing them. Now Abdusator wants to expand his business and buy more sheep. So for that he applied for a loan of 1,000 USD. Abdusator thanks all lenders for their support.

It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. loans.use: To expand a sheep business

loans.name: Davlyatbek

texts.en:
R. Davlyatbek is 58 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has dedicated himself to farming grain, carrots, and other vegetables for more than 5 years. He enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is preparing the land for planting and protecting the crops from insects that spoil his harvest. Fortunately for Davlyatbek, the products that he cultivates are in high demand in his area and fetch high prices at the market. This is his first loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants. Davlyatbek thanks all who are supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Gandjina

texts.en:
I. Gandjina is 28 years old. She is selling perfumery and cosmetics in the store which she rents. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Gandjina is dreaming of expanding her business, opening her own store, and establishing contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. Today she requests 5,500 somoni (TJS) in order to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics, such as hair color, nail varnish, lipstick, and others, with the purpose of increasing the range of her goods. Gandjina would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and cosmetics to sell, in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Murodali

texts.en:
K. Murodali is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothing for kids at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a very experienced entrepreneur, having been self-employed for the past two years. Business has been good for Murodali. There is always demand for clothing, and as the economy has improved in Tajikistan, more people have been able to afford new clothing. Murodali has requested a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) to increase his available working capital. Eventually, Murodali hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for selling

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
M. Lola is a 46-year-old mother who does sewing work in a tailoring shop to earn money for her children. She started because she loves this trade. Lola is doing her best to ensure that her children will have a good education and the best future. She hopes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a 2,000 somoni (TJS) loan that will be invested in buying a new sewing machine to increase her production and cover customers' demands. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Lola’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: To purchase new, modern fabrics for sewing national dress

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: M. Sharofat is 44 years old and is divorced with two children. Her business is the main source of income for her family. Sharofat participated in the training and now she has been running her business already for ten years. She embroiders the national skull-cap for men and women. She is really hardworking, getting up very early and going to bed very late. When she is not embroidering the skull-caps she is selling them in the local market. Sharofat is planning to expand her business. She requested 4,000 Somoni to purchase necessary supplies for embroidering national skull-caps. Having obtained a loan from IMON seven times, Sharofat had shown herself as a reliable client. Your support will really help her. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to improve her living standard. loans.use: To buy supplies for embroidering national skull-caps

loans.name: Hotam

texts.en:
Hotam is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children. For eight years, he has earned a living transporting passengers. He considers his family his main inspiration to continue to work hard.

Due to his sound money management, Hotam now owns a minivan. This helps to increase his household income. What Hotam enjoys most about his work is the direct contact he has with his passengers. His business is profitable because he himself is the driver; there is no need to pay an additional salary.

This is his first loan with IMON International. He will use the loan to buy spare parts for his minivan. With this loan, Hotam will be able to improve his large family’s livelihood. Hie wife, children and his parents will all benefit.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa T. is from the village of Capinonan, Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Felisa is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector; she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sangijon

texts.en:
Sangijon has a small business where she sells children's clothing. She is married and she has been in business for 13 years.

Sangijon is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply, but wisely. For example, when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory, rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her. This allows her to keep her business open.

Sangijon has requested a loan to help renew her supply of clothing inventory. The change of seasons means a busy time of year for clothing vendors. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.en:
Makhsuda is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and is the loving mother of two children.

Makhsuda has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning her craft in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she was able to open her own shop in her home. She has been successful because her customers recognize the high quality of her products. Because of this, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow.

Today she is requesting a loan of 4,800 Somoni to purchase the fabrics required for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life for her family. Makhsuda and her son are especially grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics required for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Najeba Group

texts.en:
Najeba is the group leader of the Najeba group. There are two members in this group. Each of them requests a loan to improve their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

Najeba requests a loan for her husband, who has a general store. Mahboba requests a loan for her embroidery business. They are very happy to participate in this process of obtaining loans in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: For expanding general store and embroidery business

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
Sherali S. is a young married man with two children. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard for him to find a job. Therefore, he began to start his own business selling teenager’s clothing and headdresses. Fortunately, he has had good sales. His business is growing because of the quality of his products and the good service he provides.

Sherali now needs a loan of $1,500 USD, which he will use to buy goods to meet his customers’ demand. Sherali is very thankful for your help, which allows him to improve his service and the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a diligent business woman. She is married to Florante who works as an all around laborer in their village. The couple helps one another to meet the daily needs of their family. They have two children. Nova, 20 years old, is an entrepreneur and college graduate now employed at Green Hornet Enterprises. Harrieth, 18 years old, currently attends college. Annie hopes that her youngest will also finish her college education.

Annie makes a living by selling homemade products such as longganisa (Filipino sausage), tocino (pork marinated with sweet sauce), and embutido, among others. For additional income, she also sells personal products made by Avon, Natasha and Sarah Lee.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP8,000 for the maintenance and growth of her businesses. Annie has already borrowed from KIVA once before. She saw how the loan allowed her to grow her income and her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for maintenace and growth of her businesses

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn V. is from the village of Purok 1, District Capinohan, Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children.

To earn a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying peanuts and selling them to her established buyers. Marilyn has been engaged in this business for over four years. She earns approximately 4,840 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more peanuts to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support and educate her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase peanuts to sell

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda T. is a married woman with three children. She started her business out of economic necessity; her husband's salary was not enough to meet their family's expenses. Mavluda began to consider what work she could do to help her family.

About six years ago, one of her friends recommended she start to sell clothing, which she did. Little by little Mavluda brought in more clients, which increased her income. As her commissions increased she was able to buy and then sell more clothing.

Mavluda is applying for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy more merchandise and to fill existing client orders. She hopes that you will collaborate with her. Together with her family, she thanks you for supporting them and helping the family move ahead.

loans.use: To increase working capital to expand the business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
“Do your best and God will do the rest.” This is what Rosario believes in life. She knows that God will help her with her business only if she will do her part as a businesswoman. Rosario is 51 years old and married to Noli, a known laborer in their village. They have four children; three of them are already studying. Their family lives in the village of Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. 

Rosario has been engaged in the poultry business for two years. She buys dozens of chicks from Cauayan City and sells them after 45 days. She is now asking for the support of Kiva lenders for the maintenance of her business. For this, she would like to borrow a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos that she needs to purchase more chicks and a food supply for their growth.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P., from the village of P-3, Bagontaas, Valencia City, is a 47-year-old married mother of a school-aged child. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a specialized retail business whose main source of income comes primarily from selling herbal and generic products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI, one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines, is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mohisa

texts.en:
Mohisa R., currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant, is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs such as beans and rice. Mohisa, 22 years old and married to a peasant, has two children, both of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay their school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Shahara

texts.en:
Shahara J., currently in the business of selling beer at her bar, is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Shahara, 24 years old and widowed, has two children, both of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike to carry crates of beer from wholesale stores to her bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and she is married to Hilario, 47 years old, who works as a farmer. They have three children and they are in the secondary level of education. She and her husband doing their best to send their children to school and hoping that they may finish their education.

Virginia is engaged in the hog-raising business. At the moment she only has one hog; the others are being sold to pay the tuition fees of her children. She wants to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10,000 that she will use to buy additional piglets, feed supplies, and for the maintenance of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additonal piglets

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna L. is from the village of P-3, Valencia City. She is 37 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products like gravestone to customers. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials to manufacture gravestones. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to manufacture gravestones

loans.name: Jesucrifina

texts.en:
Jesucrifina is 55 years old and married to Tannie, a farmer. They have two children: Jerome, 29 years old, working in an Electronics Shop and Lilibeth, 28 years old and married.

Jesucrifina is engaged in retailing DXN products. She is working double-time hoping that they can improve their way of living and cover their family's needs.

She wants to venture into another business, fruit retailing. This made her decided to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 7,000. She believes that by having this second business, her income will increase. She hopes that her loan will be approved in order to maintain and further expand her retail business.

loans.use: To engage in fruit retailing

loans.name: Nazren Group

texts.en:
Nazren is requesting a loan for her husband, who has a general store. Ghulam Raman wants to take out a loan for a shop selling vegetables. Pari Gul wants to take out a loan for her husband, who has a shop selling fresh fruits. 

Nazren is the leader of Nazren Group. The three members of this group each want a loan for expanding their businesses. They are requesting a group loan of 42,000 afghanis. They thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For a general store

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn G. is from the village of P-6, Lower Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 39 years old. Rosalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family members and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: P-6, Lower Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.en:
Sherzod is an energetic 20-year-old. From the time he was young he was looking for a way to start his own business to be able to help his parents with family expenses. With much effort he initiated his own business with very little merchandise. Selling soft drinks and juices, little by little he was able to maintain his home and start to grow his business, incorporating the sale of grocery items too and improving the quality of service he offered.

Sherzod needs a loan of 5000 Somoni, which he will use to provide more juices and soft drinks so he can continue to work hard to sustain his family. Sherzod very much appreciates your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing juices and soft drinks

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia T. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 45 years old. Lilia is separated and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling poultry and pork products (barbecue) in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of snacks like rice cakes in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
The need to expand his income and to provide his young family of two children and a wife with food were the reasons that Ulugbek started his clothing business. He is a very responsible and a hard-working father who for two years has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling clothing. Today he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to expand the business so that he can improve his family's living conditions. Ulugbek is very grateful to everyone who is helping him with the well-being of his family.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and she is married to Robert, a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Joey- 28 years old, a pastor; Janice- 26 years old, an Overseas Filipino Worker; and their youngest Jessa- 20 years old, a full-time house wife. They are residing in the village of La Paz, a rural area approximately two kilometers from the national highway of Cabatuan, Isabela.

Gloria has been a vendor of soy sauce and vinegar for almost two years, and she can earn a weekly net income of PHP3,500. Aside from that, she has also managed a junk shop business for almost three years with the help of her tribike (bicycle with a sidecar with three wheels). She wants her business to improve and for this reason, she is now asking to borrow PHP10,000 from KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great help for the maintenance and development of her two businesses.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending and junk shop business

loans.name: Jamshid

texts.en:
Jamshid is a very ambitious young man with amazing selling skills. He is 24 years old, married with a little child. He lives in Spitamen and has been working in the clothing industry for the past 2 years. He was able to expand his small business, over the year, into a well-known shop in the neighborhood.

Jamshid is a very enterprising young man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has been able to show the fruits of his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Jamshid needs a loan of 3000 Somoni, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his customers. You can be an important part of the growth of this business.

The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread such as cinnamon bread in the local community. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish products in the local community. loans.name: Dilnura

texts.en:
Dilnura is married with a little child. She runs a small store selling groceries. She has been in this business for 9 years. Dilnura is very cheery and optimistic. Her little grocery store faces high competition as there are many supermarkets in the neighborhood. However, her customer-friendly service and the individual attention she can give help her keep loyal customers.

Her responsibility and perseverance have helped Dilnura repay all loans she has received from “IMON International”. Dilnura is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni for a couple of purposes. She is going to do some remodeling work inside her vending facility and she’d like to increase the assortment of food products she has available. This loan will help Dilnura expand her business, having a positive impact on her profitability and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

loans.use: Purchasing goods  to increase the range of items sold

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
B. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 17 and 12, in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and both her daughters go to a local high school. Her husband operates a taxi service in their town while B. operates a retail food business. She cooks the food in the family’s ger and delivers it all over town to markets and office buildings.

B.'s working capital now exceeds 450,000 tugrug (~316 USD) and she has established a loyal customer following because of her delicious, quality meals. B. is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~630 USD) loan so that she can purchase food supplies and a new stove for her business.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies and a new stove for her business

loans.name: Saden Gul Group

texts.en:
Habeba is requesting a loan for a shop selling fruits. Khrma wants to take out a loan for a beadworking business. Qandi G. wants to take out a loan for her husband, who has a burger shop.

Habeba is the leader of Habeba Group. The three members of this group each want to take out a loan for business progress and expansion. They are requesting a group loan of 42,000 afghanis. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For a business selling fruits

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a vegetable vendor in their village. She plants vegetables in their backyard for their family's consumption and she also sell some of her produce. She purchases most of her merchandise in Cauayan City. With the help of her previous loan, she was able to venture into another business, fish selling. Joan would like to further grow her businesses. She is again requesting additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 6,000. She hopes that lenders will continue to support her in her small businesses to keep them growing. She is also hoping that someday she can have a more stable business.

Joan is 33 years old and she is residing in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Robert, a furniture laborer in their village. They have four children and she prays that they may able to send them to school and provide them with a good education.

loans.use: Additional capital to further grow her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is a 40-year-old farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She owns a rice field, which, according to her, needs additional financing. She also owns a general store, which sells very well during harvest time. Juvy has been a member of CEV since 2005 and is thankful she is still a member. Now, Juvy is requesting to borrow Php 7,000, which will be used to finance her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

texts.en:
Merlyn D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 55 years old. Merlyn is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling books to customers. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI.
