loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noosgoi

texts.en:
B. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and four children, aged between 24 and 17, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two older children have graduated and are working in their town, while the younger two children are still in high school.

B. and his wife work together sewing traditional Mongolian boots which they then sell at the local market. B.’s wife, Tseveen, began sewing in 1984 and her work is very popular because of its high quality.

B. also owns a car repair service which he began in 2004. This couple works hard to provide for their children and improve the quality of their lives with education. B. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase fabrics and finishing materials to be used for making boots during the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and finishing materials to be used for making boots during the upcoming winter months

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: 41-year-old Juanito D. is a farmer. He has been married to Rosalyn D. for 3 years now. He owns 2 hectares of rice field in his hometown in Agusan Del Sur. His farm is where he generates his income. He recently joined CEV to take advantage of its financial services because he admits he lacks capital for his farm. He requested to borrow Php 7,000. He will use this loan to purchase the farm inputs he needs for his farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en:
Dashdorj B. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both his young son and daughter attend a local secondary school.

B. operates a used clothing business out of a stall at the local market in his town. He started his business in 2007 with the help of his older sister after previously working as a herder for several years. In a short time, B. has made much progress in growing his business. His earnings have enabled him to buy out his sister and become the sole owner of the business, and he recently purchased a second stall at the market in order to expand his product offerings.

For the future, B. hopes to grow his business further and says, "My future business growth will help me provide for my children's education." He is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) loan to purchase more clothes to increase his clothing inventory at his new stall.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to expand his clothing inventory at his new stall

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia T. is from the village of P-10, Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 50 years old. Nelia is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over six years..

In 2009, Nelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia is requesting a loan of $125 which will be used to purchase new items to increase the number of products available in her shop. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more items for sale

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en: Adiya B. is 46 years old and lives with his mother in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. He and his mother live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. B. operates a consumer products trading business in his town. He sells a variety of household goods out of a stall at the local market. To supplement his income, he also sells items purchased from China, warm hats and scarves, during the fall and winter months. B. started his business in 2000 after previously operating a hat-making business. Since starting his consumer goods business, B. has gained much experience as a businessman and has built a stable operation. For the future, his dream is to own and operate a trading center featuring many different types of businesses. He is requesting a $1400 loan to purchase hats and scarfs to sell this coming winter. Increase inventory means increased revenue for Adiya.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell in winter

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en: Rice farming is Gemma’s source of income. She owns a hectare and a half of rice field. Gemma is a 39-year-old married woman. She is very diligent when it comes to farming because it gives her family food to eat. Gemma’s farm still lacks necessary farm supplies, so she is requesting a loan of $150. She will use this loan for fertilizers and other items needed to increase the yield her farm provides.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Tsedev

texts.en:
Tsedev A. is a 40-year-old single mother who lives with her sister and three-year-old son in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. A. owns and operates a small cafe in her town. Her cafe serves up a variety of traditional Mongolian dishes, but her most popular item is Huushuur, a deep fried flour pocket filled with meat. Her cafe is a preferred lunch spot in the community as huushuur is a quick and easy meal for many people on the go. 

A. started her cafe in 2005 and has since built a stable and successful operation. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a two-room apartment to house her cafe. She is very hardworking and has built her cafe into one of the most popular dining spots in her town.  A. is very hopeful for the future and says, "One can achieve anything they want if they work hard." She hopes to soon expand her business and has plans to start a clothing trade business to supplement her income. She is requesting a  $2500 loan to purchase food supplies for her cafe and to invest in starting a clothing trade business.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her cafe and to invest in a clothing trade business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and is married to Eduardo T., a tricycle driver within their village. Her family lives in the beautiful village of Magsaysay Saguday, Quirino. They are blessed with two children: Edwin, who is 26 years old and a college graduate who is an OFW in Dubai. and Joel a 21-year-old 2nd year college student. Helen dreams that her youngest son will also finish his schooling.

Helen sells native cakes, vinegar, home made peanut butter and frozen products in the canteen in their school. Her frozen products and homemade peanut butter are quickly snapped up by her customers.are always quick to be sold out and same with her homemade peanut butter. Her products are in high demand, but she requires more capital in order to have the money for the ingredients for her homemade frozen food, native cakes, peanut butter and other snacks. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase the ingredients she needs to expand production. This increased income will help her see her second child through school.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and increase food production

loans.name: Hatpa

texts.en:
Hatpa A. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, Lena, is a teacher at a local secondary school; his son, Danial, is a university student; and his youngest daughter, Roza, is in high school. A. and his wife make a living selling milk. They have several cows at home that produce the milk they sell. On average, each cow produces about six litres of milk a day. A. started this business in 2004 and has succeeded at expanding it, selling each litre of milk for 1,800 tugrugs (about $1) and earning monthly profits of roughly 324,000 tugrugs (or about $230).  A., who dreams of owning his own cow farm, is requesting a loan of 480,000 tugrug (or $340 USD) to buy hay to feed to his cows.					

His wife is pictured above

loans.use: To buy hay to feed to his cows

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Mariafe joined CEV last May to take advantage of the financial help it offers. She makes a living growing rice on her 1.5 hectare farm. Her crop has just begun to grow, and she needs supplies such as fertilizer to keep it healthy and free from weeds and pests. Mariafe is 35 years old and lives with her husband Ruben. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000, which she will use to expand her business and achieve greater success in life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her farm

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon B. lives in the village of Taguilon. She is 44 years old, married, has five school-aged children and makes a living by fishing. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two loans from PMPC, and is now applying for a new loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to help pay for her children's education.

PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as hooks and nets

loans.name: Shirmen

texts.en: Munkhbayar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and six-year-old daughter in the Tuv province of Mongolia. He operates a local coal and wood transportation business. Coal and wood are two types of fuel used to heat gers and houses during the Mongolian winter. Munkhbayar opened this business earlier this year, after closing a retail business he had run for several years. His daily earnings are between 15,000 and 25,000 tugrugs (about $10-17). He has been so successful in his new line of work that he has been able to build a house for his family and a small shop near his home. He plans to sell food in this shop in order to further improve his family’s quality of life and stabilize his earnings when fuel sales decrease in the summer. Munkhbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (about $1,400 USD) loan to buy coal and wood for his fuel business and food items for his new shop.

loans.use: To purchase coal and wood for his fuel transportation business and food items for his new shop

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon makes a living running a sari-sari (or community) store in the village of Dibul Saguday, Quirino, Isabela. She is thankful to God for all the blessings that she receives both at work and at home.  

Corazon is committed to expand her business, and has applied for a loan from Kiva for PHP 5,000.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise to sell to her customers.  

She is married to Conrado, who works as a driver and a farmer.  They have two children: Desiree, who is 5 years old and in preschool and Nicca, who is 7 months old.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Promise Mae

texts.en:
Promise Mae L. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 26 years old. Promise Mae is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Promise Mae owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear (RTW) items and sometimes a variety of fishes in the local community. Promise Mae has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Promise Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Promise Mae is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Promise Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is happy to share that her crops are growing well. She is a 34-year-old married woman who enjoys tending her farm. Her 3 1/2 hectare field is composed of rice crops.

Still in need of farm inputs, she applied for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEV, where she is a member. She will use this loan to purchase the needed inputs to ensure a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase inputs for her farm

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita O. started her farming business way back in 1999. She is 53 years old now and married. She tills her own rice field in her place in Agusan Del Sur, which is about 1 3/4 hectares.

Nenita needs financing for her farm, so she requested a load of loan Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This loan will help Nenita sustain her rice farm.

loans.use: To sustain her rice farm

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado E. is from the village of Sugarlane, Lumbo Valencia City. He is 48 years old. Disodado is married and has 2 adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Diosdado owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Diosdado has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Diosdado joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdado is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Diosdado from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items for his store

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en:
Amarsaikhan is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 14 and 11, in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of her sons attend a local secondary school.

Amarsaikhan operates a used clothing retail business. She began her business in 1999 with a working capital of 50,000 tugrug (~35 USD). After years of hard work, determination and good business sense, her working capital now exceeds 450,000 tugrug (~316 USD). She is known to provide a wide variety of quality clothing to her customers and has a large customer base in her local market.

Amarsaikhan is requesting a 400,000 tugrug (~280 USD) loan in order to purchase more quality used clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more quality used clothing for her business

loans.name: Ahtankajaa

texts.en:
Ahtankajaa S. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He lives together with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son currently attends a local secondary school and his younger daughter is in kindergarten.

Ahtankajaa operates a vegetable trading business in his town. He grows and sells a variety of vegetables at the local market. Due to the short growing season and long winters in Mongolia, Ahtankajaa preserves most of his vegetables through the winter and sells them in the spring when demand is high. He purchases vegetables from other farmers to sell during the fall and winter months.

Ahtankajaa started his business in 2004 when he began growing vegetables on two hectares (5 acres) of land he owns. Since then, he has built a stable operation and hopes to expand in the near future by planting more vegetables. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase two tons of beets and three tons of carrots to sell.

loans.use: To purchase two tons of beets and three tons of carrots to sell

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a 47-year-old mason who also sells livestock. He has been in this business for five years. He runs his business in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He is requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy goats for sale. A father of six, Johnbosco hopes to grow his business from just selling goats to selling cows and bulls in large numbers and supplying livestock to Kenya Meat Commission for slaughter. This loan will go a long way in facilitating this dream. He describes himself as confident and determined. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Razi Group

texts.en:
Razi has requested a loan for an embroidery business. Donui wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a general store. Sadiqa wants a loan for a knitting business. Mahwar wants to take out a loan for a tailoring business.

Razi is the leader of Razi Group. The four members of this group each want to take out a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group loan of 40,000 afghanis. They admire this loan process.

loans.use: For an embroidery business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: 31-year-old Nenita S. is a married woman and a mother to a 4-year-old child. Her business is rice farming in her hometown in Agusan Del Sur. The rice crops on her farm are starting to grow now and need proper nurture. She is requesting a loan of PHP7,000. She will use this loan to purchase the necessary inputs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy inputs for her farm

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. J., together with her beloved husband, is striving to earn enough income to support the education of their two children who are presently studying in tertiary education. Being parents, they are concerned with the future of their children. They sacrifice everything to send their children to school for they know that education is the only way to find a stable job. 
	The main source of their income is farming. They cultivate their farm lots in two cropping cycles by planting rice and vegetables. Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, they need to earn more income to meet their daily needs and finance the tuition fees and allowances of their children. In this regard, Alma put up a small eatery in their village located at Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya to earn additional income. She started this with a small amount of capital in which she can only earn a net income of P 500.00 per week. In this regard, she wants to improve it but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to P 5,000.00 to be added to her capital to improve her small eatery. She wants to buy more ingredients for her eatery. She believes that with her patience and sacrifices, she will be able to improve her business and support the studies of their two children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook

loans.name: Al-Nelia

texts.en:
Al-nelia C. is from the village of P-9, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 32 years old. Al-nelia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Al-nelia owns & operates a specialized retail business selling purified water and offering Beauty Salon services in the local community. Al-nelia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Al-nelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Al-nelia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Al-nelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en: Panfila S. is a 56-year-old farmer. She is married and has three children. She currently tills a 4-hectare rice field, which is the main source of her income. New to borrowing money from a microfinance, she finds the monthly amortization convenient. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and other inputs needed for her farm to flourish.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Gemma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma raises pigs for sale. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional baby pigs, feed, and necessary supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gemma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and supplies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Yolanda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda sells "ukay-ukay" or second hand clothing in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronquillo

texts.en: Mr. Ronquillo S. is a hard-working farmer. He is 56 years old. According to him, his farming is flowing smoothly but he’s still lacking additional inputs. He joined CEVI a year ago and he likes the monthly amortization. He said there was enough time for him to save up for the next month’s payment. Ronquillo is currently requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. This loan will surely help him grow his farm immensely.

loans.use: To purchase inputs for his farm

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en: Joy N. is 35 years old and the leader of her group in Rukungiri. She is married and has five children with ages ranging from 15 years to 1 year old. Joy operates and owns a chemical shop in Rwenshaka that generates 100,000 USH per month in profits. She would like a loan of 300,000 USH to purchase more inventory and expand her product offerings. Her future business goals include expanding to several of the other local towns and her personal hope is to be able to pay for the educations of all her children.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 50 years old and resides in the village of Quirino, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Due hardships and difficulties in life, she only finished high school.  She is married to Jun and they are blessed with three children. Despite financial problems, they are striving hard to send their children to school for they want them to finish their studies and hopefully become successful in the future.  

Angelina and her husband are snack vendors in Bagabag Junction.  They sell buko (coconut) pie, buko juice and corn. Because of their patience and sacrifices, they can earn a monthly income of PHP 5,000.00 a month, which they need to budget for their daily needs and the schooling of their children. For the continuous improvement of their business, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000 from the KIVA lenders.  This amount will assist her to purchase more goods to make her business grow and to support the financial needs of their children.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 31-year-old business lady who operates a pharmacy in Pipeline Nairobi. She has been in this business for four years now. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to increase her stock of medicine. A mother to one, Constance hopes to open multiple outlets and diversify into rental units. This loan will go a long way in facilitating her dream. She describes herself as determined and hardworking.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase her stock of medicine

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is a farmer. He is 32 years old, married and blessed with six children, his eldest being only 14 years old.

Salvador’s field is comprised of rice crops. He wants to make sure his crops are growing healthy because, aside from generating income from it, he wants to sell quality rice to his buyers. He is now requesting to loan Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. This loan will help Salvador in his dream to sell quality products.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Jefferson L. is from the village of Sugarland, Lumbo, Valencia City. He is 22 years old and is single. Jefferson owns and operates a business selling purified drinking water in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jefferson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en: Obadiah is a 31-year-old businessman who operates a supermarket dealing with foodstuffs and household items in Nairobi’s Pipeline estate. He has been in this business for the past four years. He is requesting for a loan of Kes 60,000 to add stock into his supermarket. Obadiah hopes to also own a wholesale shop and become one of the leading distributors of products in his estate. He describes himself as hardworking and determined. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock to his supermarket

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a father to seven children. He is 58 years old and married. His business is rice farming and he also sells fish when it is not harvest season.

Samuel joined CEVI last June and is grateful for the financial service he was able to obtain. Now he is requesting to loan Php 7,000 which he will use to purchase farm inputs that his farm lacks.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria A. is engaged in the fattening of pigs. Her business is located in their village of San Jose Norte 1, Mallig, Isabela.

Mrs. A. ventured first in a retailing business through a variety store. Though her variety store business allows her to support the daily needs of her family she then decided to engage into raising pigs because she learned that she can earn more income in that business. With that, she decided to obtain a loan of Php 7,000 from ASKI which she will use to purchase feed for her pigs.

Mrs. A. is blessed with two children and at present she serves as a mother and father to her children. Their first child has already finished her studies and is presently working in Manila as a factory worker.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en: Eusebio Pador, Jr. is from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. He is 53 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Eusebio owns and operates a business providing space for rent to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eusebio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly C. is 29 years old, married and from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. Rosaly owns and runs a “sari-sari” (variety) shop from which she sells both food and items for daily use to the local community. Rosaly has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosaly joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Rosaly is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosaly from HSPFI. She plans to use any additional profits to build up her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell in her "sari-sari"

loans.name: Ndidi

texts.en: Ndidi is 30 years old, single, and has no children. He sells automobile spare parts to earn a living. He hopes to expand this business by working hard to lift his business out of poverty. He has been in the business for four years. He is requesting a loan for N60,000 to purchase more automobile spare parts to sell. He expresses his gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts to sell

loans.name: Nike Bakat Group

texts.en: Nike Bakat is the leader of this group, which has four members. Each member wants a loan to expand their business, so the group is requesting a loan of 40000 Afghani. Nike Bakat is seeking a loan for a tailoring business. Sadiqa wants a loan for the business of quilt making. Gul Handam and his wife N. would like a loan to support their general store. So they are happy for the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina G. is already 57 years old. She manages a vegetable and food vending business and also sells some grocery items at her stall. Her weekly net income is Php 250. Wanting to increase her income, she planned to have a loan of Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional working capital for her business.

Marcelina is married to a farmer named Eulogio and they are blessed with four children namely: Cynthia - 34 years of age, a housekeeper; Marlon - 30 years of age, a security guard in Manila; Laurence - 26 years of age; and their youngest is Emma Bella - 24 years of age, a housekeeper also. They reside at Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, located near Villa Concepcion Elementary school.

Marcelina hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan to sustain her family needs and most especially for the continued productivity of her business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Abieyuwa sells frozen foods like turkey, chicken and fish within her community in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is 36 years old, married, and has no children. She has been in this business for 6 years. She is applying for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
Rogers is 25 years old and the leader of his group in Rukungini. He is married and has a baby boy who is only 10 months old. Additionally, he cares and provides for his sister’s daughter.

Rogers has been in the poultry business for five years and operates a stall in the central market of Rukungini. The small operation generates 70,000 USH per week in profits.

With the loan of 600,000 USH he plans on purchasing more chicks and expanding his business. One day he hopes to be able to build a house for his family to live in and pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en: Bernadeta P. is from the village of P-6A, Valencia City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Bernadeta owns and operates a business selling a variety of vegetables in the local market. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernadeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine owns a restaurant where he sells drinks and cooked foods. He is 26 years old and single without a child. He has been in his business for two years. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and to renovate his shop. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Donata's Group

texts.en:
K. Donata is a friendly and hardworking lady who has had a clinic in Kashozi trading centre as her business for fifteen years. Before moving to the trading centre, she started working from the village and only moved because the market was not good. But she is happy where she is now.

Donata is 37 years old and married with three children aged between 14 and 6 years. She also takes care of four dependents.

Donata offers medical care and first aid to the local people and hence is an important factor in her local community. She is able to make 340,000/= as profits each month and this helps her in taking care of her family plus paying the children’s school fees.

Donata still has a dream of moving to the main town of Bushenyi to transact her business from there, since the population there is large. She has been successful so far because of her good customer language and friendliness, in addition to the loans that help increase her capital every time she uses them.

Donata needs a loan to help with the completion of her children’s school fees since she would like them to a obtain the best education up to university level.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Risolat

texts.ru: Рисолат Каримова проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж пенсионер. Сама клиентка более 20 лет занимается торговлей у себя в магазине. Она в основном торгует хозяйственными товарами. Кредит просит для увеличения ассортимента и товараоборота.
texts.en:
Risolat K. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 48 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is retired. Risolat has been involved in retail sales at her store for over 20 years. She primarily sells household goods. She is requesting a loan in order to increase selection and goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods selection

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Asha is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en: Juliah is a 29-year-old mother of one who operates a clothing sales business in Nairobi’s Pipeline area. She has been in this business for three years. Juliah is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of new clothes to her business. She hopes to open multiple branches and educate her children to the highest level. She describes herself as hardworking and serious. About Faulu Kenya Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more clothing stock.

loans.name: Lusviminda

texts.en:
Lusviminda D. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Lusviminda is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living, Lusviminda operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for this business is from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Lusviminda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lusviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lusviminda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 33 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael sells secondhand electronics to make a living. He is 60 years old and married with six children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes for a loan of 40,000 nairas to purchase more secondhand electronics to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand electronics to sell
